Now before we get to the big problem with this movie I want to address the little ones. Firstly the production design is blandy bland bland, nothing interesting, nothing to right home about, just bland. This unappealing look is made worse by frequent use of really bad CGI. This movie has competent actors but none of them are interested in making a good movie so the performances aren't bad, bad can be fun, they're just weak. The plot is weak, the action is almost competent except the editing and CGI conspire to ruin it. The soundtrack is bad generic female black pop music (think discount versions of Beyonce or Brandy) that is obnoxious to listen to. Now if these were all the problems this would just be direct-to-video bad, nothing to compete with Hulk or Elektra just bad. There is one aspect of the movie that manages to single handedly make this one of the worst superhero movies of all time. The horribly misguided feminism. Dear lord this movie's treatment of women is awful! It tries to be all empowering and yet ever single female character in this movie is defined by her relationship to men. Worst still this movie has all the clichés you find in bad chick flicks; questionable morals, idiot characters, gay friend because men and women can't just be friends, an awkward bumbling lead, a dumb leading man. And then on top of that add all the clichés of a bad female superhero movie; objectification of women, sexist male villains, older women villains, girl power motifs and a costume designed more to excite juvenile viewers then it is to actually serve any function in combat. In summary this movie is decent idea filtered through the very worst clichés that cinema has to offer. This isn't even fun in a bad way it's just bad. Avoid at all cost.

Okay, I will admit it.  This movie was a letdown, although enjoyable during certain scenes (i.e. the basketball game) and some obviously dull plot devices (the ferris wheel and the little boy).  But you can't blame Halle. She had nothing to work with.  The plot was lame.  Some of the CG was laughable.  I say just take the movie for what it is.  A movie.  Purely meant for entertainment.  But I think Halle has gotten the superhero thing out of her system and hopefully she'll concentrate more on drama (which believe it or not) she is actually quite good at. And in any event, Halle got her 14 million and I ain't mad at her.  I'll say this, Catwoman was a helluva lot better than Charlie's Angels Full Throttle.  You talking about something that sucked.

reviews.review_title: makes me wanna kick a cat
reviews.content: All right, the CG in this movie is as bad as the CG in every movie that stars a comic book character. But when the special effects team finished designing their CG model of Halle Berry Barry Bo-Berrie, they were faced with a dilemma: Should we stick with this movie and get paid? Or should we give the public what it really wants, which is a five-hour computer-generated orgy starring Halle Berry, Sharon Stone and one hundred demonic aliens with phallic tentacles? They chose the former, and the result is this insulting film about cats and the women who want to be them.Cats have bad breath, but did you know? It's actually bad enough to wake the dead, literally. Also, cats have super strength, and are great at basketball.In order to make the most educated opinion I could on this movie, I watched it with no sound. Even so, I came away with a perfect grasp of the plot, which reveals that any dialog in the film is purely incidental. Take away the dialog and you're left with action scenes that look like a Playstation game. And no alien porn. It's a lose-lose situation, this movie.

reviews.review_title: I Can't Believe They would do this...
reviews.content: I am an extremely huge fan of the bat-films as well as the comic books and the original Adam West TV series. This is NOT the story of Catwoman, hell, she didn't even HAVE a story!!! The only story is that on the TV Show she had different disguises to fool Batman and make it easier to defeat him, which they never did. Not to mention, she is an extremely evil human being, yet, the writers of this decided to make her a good person and all that. Even in Batman Returns, she was a nice person turned menace, and this movie didn't quite show her bad side, unless she was robbing a bank or something.In other words, this movie SUCKED!!!

reviews.review_title: I thought the Movie was Captivating - A Must See
reviews.content: I really enjoyed this movie. After reading all the negative comments about Halle Berry doing such a movie, as if it were beneath her as an actress, I was pleasantly surprised. The graphics and fight scenes were impressive, and it's even more impressive to know that Halle did most of her own stunts.If I'm being honest, and I am....The movie was very enjoyable and I honestly liked it better than the "Bourne Supremacy". It's unfortunate that people want you to act in the movies they think you should (that's a lot of nerve). I respect that Halle is very versatile and she's a very good actress. I did not like Monster's Ball, although she did an excellent job, so to see her in such a lighter toned movie was wonderful. The movie was fun, exciting, and simply purrrrrfect!!! And most importantly, it looked like she had a great time making it. Sharon Stone was great as well....she makes for an excellent villain!!!

reviews.review_title: Not a hell of a mess, not even close. Catwoman is pure campy entertainment.
reviews.content:
Catwoman. Directed by Pitof. **It is incredible the trash that "Catwoman" has been receiving from critics and from comic's hardcore fans. Geez! I can think at least half a dozen films that have been worse and came out this year. "Van Helsing" was cocky, annoying, and corny as hell. "Troy" and "King Arthur" dreamed of being masterpieces, but they only achieved turkey-status, both of them well founded on mediocrity, that made the whole thing boring as a turtle. "Torque" and "The Whole Ten Yards" shows Hollywood insistence in making pointless films.Of course, "Catwoman" is not "Harry Potter" or "Spidey 2" . But I must dare to say that as popcorn, entertainment value is on the same level. I had fun watching it. Campy fun, but still fun. I am not ashamed of it."Catwoman" comes to be the anti thesis of "Spidey ". Catwoman was ditched by most of the critics, while "Spidey" got an overrated love from most of them: it was qualified as the ultimate cinematic masterpiece. Give me a freaking break! It is a great film, but it's not flawless. Catwoman was a box office bomb. Spidey domestic gross alone stands close to the 400 million mark.Acting is over acting. Writing is pure trash (what would you expect if three people created the "story" and other three wrote the screenplay). Pitof's direction is way weak. But "Catwoman" has charm. Halle Berry performance is on top of overacting, but she still is so hot. Mrs. Stone's lines are ridicule and absurd, but she's having fun like a dwarf.
In the technical aspects Catwoman is a good film. It performs one of the best Sound Design I've heard in ages; that part is truly Oscar worthy. It is visually stunning as well. Watching it makes you abnoxius; and that actually is a good thing.6/10.

Here's the scene: (This is not a spoiler, it's all in the movie summary so don't worry) Poor nervous, shy (and, of course, beautiful) "Patience" -- clever name -- accidentally finds out her employer's dastardly plans, so they kill her off. She is drowned by the pipes she runs into. Her dead body washes up on a piece of yucky land.Suddenly a large group of cats begins to form around her dead body. I swear I thought they were going to break out into a big number of "Jelicho Cats." One of them -- you'll recognize him from earlier in the movie -- crawls up onto her and breathes some supernaturalness into her mouth. Now she is a catwoman.Need I say more?

reviews.review_title: Cat woman: Sour milk. Warning spoilers.
reviews.content: When Batman Returns (1992) was released people really enjoyed Michelle Pfeiffer's take on Cat woman and who can blame them? It was a kick ass roll that turned into one of her most famous roles. A spin off movie was planned to start shortly after the Batman returns in 1993 with Michelle Pfeiffer reprising her role along with Tim Burton directing it. The agreement fell through due to conflicting priorities with Pfeiffer's family life and Burton slowing losing interest in the project. The film would sit in development hell for years until Halle Berry would sign onto the project around 2002. The film would get released on the 23rd of July 2004....We waited so many years for this...this movie....Instead of Salina Kyle we have Patience Phillips (Halle Berry) a meek and lonely woman who works at an evil beauty company, we know that she is meek and clumsy by the amount of people and objects she bumps into and says sorry to in the opening minutes of the movie. It is about as subtle as a pancake to the face because of the sheer amount of persons she bumps into which are almost ten people. Then we are introduced to her slightly ugly (but not really) best friend and the obligatory deeply offensive gay best friend, both of these characters have very little to no bearing on the plot and will not be of any focus because the film put so little effort into making them interesting. The evil make up company (I am not joking) is run by Sharon Stone and Lambert Wilson both who have characters who are so one dimensionally evil that I half expected them to cackle like hyenas while twirling their mustaches. They are creating face cream that will cause the face to rot off if the cream stops being used (I am not joking). Halle Berry overhears this evil plot and is killed off to which a magical cat called Midnight breathes on her (Again, I am not joking) and then Patience Phillips becomes....CATWOMAN!But what is a Cat woman?Well the key, according to this movie is in the name Cat-woman, it is woman who is also a cat. The cat part is very important to this movie as after the cat breathing session Halle Berry has vertical pupils, she sleeps on shelves, she devours tuna by the ton, drinks milk, hisses at dogs, jumps and walks like a cats, ALWAYS lands on her feet and sees in the dark.The fun does not stop there as one aspect of being a Cat Woman is that she likes jewelry and skin tight leather because cats like that too I suppose.Now we move onto that costume, that infamous costume. I am sure that you the reader will know what I am talking about. It is on every single promotional material for this movie. Let me be frank, it is hideous, it is about as sexy as a festering wound, it is a BDSM costume gone wrong, I might as well as call her Cat-gimp thanks to that costume.So with the superhero thing just about set up but with no reason to care, Halle Berry sets out to expose the evil company from letting the skin rotting cream from hitting the market, all the while trying to balance dating a cop who's name I also cannot remember but I know is played by Benjamin Bratt who is also investigating the new and mysterious cat woman for a series of murders that Sharon Stone has framed on the Cat woman. He is so inept at his job that even when he faces Cat woman he can't tell it is his girlfriend despite the suit not really obscuring much, in terms of identity, no he has to go through unnecessary tasks of finger print analysis and lip analysis even when the answer is obvious to all.Eventually things come to ahead and Halle Berry and Sharon stone fight in a drunkenly edited fight scene that is too hard to follow or to care. By the way did you know that if you continue to use the skin rotting cream often enough your skin will turn as hard as granite? This is a big threat to Halle Berry until hits her enough which causes the skin to rot because reasons. Only watch if you want to see a hot, silly, incoherent scrapheap of a move for the laughs it can provide.

reviews.review_title: Beyond Hope of Anything Salvageable From the Start
reviews.content: Movies like this are like an irreparable watch. No matter how many times you try to clean it, replace the battery, or alter it in some way, it will always be no longer able to function. The only solution, in that case, would be to just abandon it and obtain a new one. But if you know Hollywood, they tend to take the "what you see is what you get" approach in order to squeeze the next buck out of us. But this time, the joke was on them; this movie flopped at the box office at the time of its release, and for good reason.This movie was doomed from the very minute Michelle Pfeiffer and Tim Burton backed out during pre-production. As soon as you try to get someone new to direct, write, and star, people should expect different ideas from different people. So, it shouldn't come as a surprise that the script was being tossed back and forth from writer to writer 27 times in order to "perfect" the so-called "story" about a Batman character that wasn't particularly strong enough to have a movie based around her in the first place, and the title role was being recast more times than was deemed necessary. It also shouldn't come as a surprise that the end result was something with so much coherency squeezed out of it that it no longer resembled Bob Kane's work (they probably should've left his name off the credits after the 5th revision).I like Halle Barry as much as the next person, but she's just way too wrong for the role, and she knows it (her Razzie acceptance speech can be found circulating around YouTube to justify this). I could be counted amongst the large mass of people that thinks the director picked her because she was able to strut perfectly in the strangely skimpy costume. But, I think I can also safely say that the poor quality of her performance that was turned out in the film was not a fault of her own; she's given so very little to work with that it's impossible for her to take the role of Patience Phillips' Catwoman seriously without looking ridiculous. (... "Patience Phillips"? Really, Hollywood? Was "Selena Kyle" too over-the-top for you?) The supporting cast doesn't help matters either, judging from the fact that they either have characters that are only on screen to be awkward, or they (almost) always give the camera the "what-the-heck-am-I-doing-here?" look.The visuals offered in this movie are far from practical, from a CGI Barry performing impossible stunts in some scenes, to extreme long shots of CGI buildings that seem unfinished. My guess is that Warner Brothers spent so much money on getting the script finished and Barry cast that the thought of having anything inanimate or non-human on screen was inconceivable, even if it meant they had to animate them properly (to them, of course).All in all, there's nothing salvageable here, but it's also very easy to see why it has a cult following that's developed over the years just for its horrible quality. If you have the urge to break out a DVD copy of this movie and pull it apart with some friends, feel free (though I wouldn't recommend making a drinking game out of it, for those of you of legal age; it's that stupid).

reviews.review_title: Girl appears dead, cats show up, she's not dead. In fact, now she's part cat, not the pathetic office geek. Now she a sexy, whip carrying tempest called the Catwoman.
reviews.content: Horrible, absolutely horrible.One cliché after another. Sharon Stoone was terrible. Did I ask, wasn't there only one black girl in town. I wonder who Catwoman could be? Lame.I've read comments that there weren't not sex scenes, hell, they should have added them. This film could use all of the help it could get.The story is very shallow which leads us to question why deviate from the Comic book at all? Benjamin Bratt was nothing more than eye candy. He's proved with his television work, that he can act. He just didn't for this project.Decent costume and set designs keep this from being a ONE. In fact, I don't know if I've ever given a film a one, so this is basically on my lists of Worse Films EVER!!!
It may not be the best movie but it's one of the movies I always enjoy no matter how many times I watch it.

reviews.review_title: Quite possibly the worst film ever made
reviews.content: Most bad movies, even though they are bad, can still provide entertainment value for its listeners by providing bad dialog to make fun of, or glaring plot holes that are fun to point out. But "Catwoman" is literally SO bad in every conceivable way that I personally couldn't even find enjoyment from pointing out all its faults-- there were just so many.As others have already pointed out, the film crams it down your throat that Halle Berry is a CAT-woman, to the point of being insulting. But that's just the tip of the iceberg. The acting is dreadfully bad, the lines are terrible and terribly delivered (not even George Lucas could write dialog this bad), the action sequences are out of place and usually happen for no logical reason, and the film's continuity suggests that two different people with completely opposite personalities edited it. Hollywood would do the whole world a lot of good if it blacklisted this director from ever making another film.I've seem some crappola movies over the years ("Plan 9 from Outer Space", "Killer Klowns from Outer Space", "Gigli") and I can enjoy even the bad ones because I stop trying to immerse myself in the story and just laugh at the film itself. Unfortunately, "Catwoman" was so bad that I couldn't do either-- it has no story or compelling characters, and is just such a pile of dung that it can only be described as an utter waste of time. I warn anyone considering this movie that you are preparing to throw away two hours of your life that you can never get back. Friends don't let friends drive drunk, and they sure as heck shouldn't let them watch "Catwoman."

reviews.review_title: No logic to speak of in this but the women sure look hot (possible spoilers)
reviews.content: This movie looks to have lost all logic. I hope that this logic turns up in M. Night Shyamalan's new movie The Village instead. One thing that this movie does have is Halle Berry in a very tight fitting leather suit that looks like she probably needs a lot of help getting into from her personal assistants. Sharon Stone also looks quite good despite having a haircut that looks like it should actually scare cats away. Perhaps that was the point of that haircut.As far as writing of the movie, I am not sure that anyone would really want to take credit for it as this looks like a real candidate for an Alan Smithee entry as screenwriter. You can almost see the comic book captions beside the heads of various characters especially Catwoman. Unlike Spider-Man 1 and 2 though it often looks like these imaginary captions are anything but tongue-in-cheek.The whip work by Halle Berry is quite impressive. This should make this movie very attractive to dominatrixes and their prey. I even noticed in the credits that there was a whip coach for Ms. Berry.

reviews.review_title: How could it be so bad with this cast?
reviews.content: Berry looks great, the rest of the cast, well they are not bad actors. There is something in this movie that completely ruins it. Is it the music, the text, I don't know. But it's so bad that it makes it uniek in it's own way 😂

previous people have said the movie was bad but you have to be a fan of cat women through the years to get it ...... the movie was great for it's ability to explain some things .... not to mention Halley Berry is the bomb. it's worth it to watch her. she has the walk down and can carry off the attitude..... Sharon Stone is classy and beautiful.... as for the comments through out the movie like "Cat got you tongue?" that stuff is funny and well placed. I won't say it's the best movie in the world but for people who like comic book movies and themes it's a must see. the story telling was good if you followed the story through comic books. I was particularly impressed that they finally took the time to explain how people became cat women and why

Catwoman is an adaptation of Bob Kane's graphic novel,directed by French director Pitof.This movie is a genuine trash classic,it doesn't deserves 10 stars,but it deserves 6 because it is full of camp and style,Halle Berry is really bad but really sexy in her role.Sharon Stone is also really bad,probably the worst villain in the comic book adaptations so far.Benjamin Bratt did a good job in this movie.But this movie is really a classic because it has it's own unforgettable moments.Every fan of trash movie will really enjoy in this movie,but if you are interested in watching quality movies like for example The Usual Suspects or the Shawshank Redemption you probably will not enjoy in this kind of movie.the title of my review says it all.It's a trash classic.

reviews.review_title: This is the role that Halle Berry was born to play
reviews.content: Superficially attractive, vapid, and insulting to the intelligence.It is the worst film of the modern era. And I have seen Jersey Girl twice.The plot is relentlessly obvious, the acting nonexistent, and the special effects this film depends so desperately on are nothing at all to write home about.Add to that the fact that the villain's gimmick is utterly spurious - concussive damage, anyone - and what we have here is a train wreck of a movie. There are more sympathetic characters in George W Bush's inner circle.I suspect that it will be shoplifted in great quantities by neds, chavs and rat-boys the world over, since Berry has an appealing body - but quite why this constitutes a reason to see a film eludes me completely.

Since this movie is being reviewed by me. A person who has never written a review before and that too after 8 years of release I don't expect many people to take what I have to say seriously and I am trolling in NO WAY!A few days ago after a long and hectic day I stumbled upon this movie, it's not a masterpiece but we're talking about a woman whose basically a cat so you have no right to judge this movie for it's intellectual capacity. Okay?Now what? it's entertaining and Halle Berry has definitely got what can be termed as "SWAG", adding to her swag is a very dashing looking Benjamin Bratt he's a treat to watch throughout and his exotic-ness is to die for.All I am saying here is that okay don't buy it on DVD, never make a conscious effort to watch this movie or ever try to intentionally look for it. But whenever it plays on TV and you happen to stumble upon it while changing the channels. DO NOT SWITCH IT OFF.Just have fun with smexy looking Halle Berry, awesome Benjamin Bratt, the purring and action sequences that can be described as 'feline'.Just enjoy this like a chilled out viewer, not a snobby critic.

Okay. There's been a lot of debate in the comments on whether this movie is as poor as some claim. I'm one of those people who say it is. I do not think this movie deserves even its current rating. There's this thing I can't stand in a movie: A line or an event of extreme idiocy or stupidity. It's like someone stabs me with a needle every time something simply too stupid happens on the screen. A typical blockbuster has a few of these, Catwoman had a years worth. The movie is incredibly stupid. The characters are stupid, the dialogue is incredibly stupid, the action scenes are stupid and the entire scenario of the movie is truly stupid. Stupid.In addition, the direction is horrible, Halle throws her worst performance I've seen to date, other actors are awful and the movie has no "atmosphere" to speak of, it feels incredibly pretentious and poorly written from start to finish.Absolutely dreadful. 1 point for the outfit and the laughs.

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as expected but certainly not one for my "to buy" list...
reviews.content: After all the bad wrap I have read about this film, I thought I should bite the bullet and go and see it (after all, people badmouthed Gigli and Battlefield Earth, both of which were 'ok').What I got for my trouble was a nicely made film, with pleasant effects, good action sequences, great acting but sadly a terrible script and story!**MINOR SPOILERS** The main foe or nemesis in this film (Sharon Stone) is a very bad choice for an enemy to a 'superhero' as she has no discernible talents beyond her eeeeeevilness!!! Sharon Stone, bless her cotton socks, does a great job portraying the character but sadly there just wasn't enough meat to it to work with and the final battle at the end if diabolically bad!As for the main star Halle Berry, once again her acting is impeccable and she looks to really enjoy the role she has but it seems too far caught up in being 'catty' and throw in humorous anecdotes about cats to be a respected character. This is not too say the portrayal is poor, she does a great job in slinking around like a feline but sometimes it looks so smutty you expect a XXX movie to kick in!So to wrap up.....A good visual film and showing great acting promise for the new role for the two main ladies but severely let down by the terrible story and script. Fingers crossed part 2 will be better. Deserves an average 5 out of 10.

reviews.review_title: I couldn't believe how awful this movie was
reviews.content: After hearing all the bad reviews on this movie, I thought it was impossible, not movie with Halle Berry could be that bad. Then I watched this movie with a couple of friends, and after watching the entire thing...I couldn't believe what one of my friends said the moment the credits started to roll, "Well that was a waste of $8".The movie didn't really have point did it? it was just all special effects and Halle Berry doing her thing. It's hard to believe that a movie would feature both Halle Berry and Sharon Stone could be this bad. Halle Berry was no Michelle Phiffer, but that wont stop to remind me that she's Hot as hell.

reviews.review_title: Though not Oscar-caliber, still enjoyable (possible spoilers)
reviews.content: Needless to say, you can't go into this movie expecting Schindler's List. However, it's a fun, no-brainer movie. The plot is rather simple and unbelievable, with a woman becoming reborn with cat reflexes and a beauty cream that makes one's face numb, but that's all the plot is suppose to do: take you out of reality and imagine what if? If plot isn't enough, the cast, overall, plays their characters relatively well. Big props to Patience's friends in the office. Good and realistic comedy. If all else fails, men will enjoy seeing Halle's caboose shake and for the ladies, Benjamin Bratt with his shirt off is a nice sight. A good flick, just don't expect much when you watch it.

reviews.review_title: No hint of Batman's Catwoman, more a version of "The Crow" (SPOILER)
reviews.content: Let's face it - when advertisements for the movie "Catwoman" appeared, most people thought they get the same Catwoman from "Batman Returns". The expectations were high - but (un)fortunately, "Catwoman" is the same in name only.Michelle Pfeiffer was the perfect incarnation the the Catwoman from the World of Batman, Pinguin, etc. She fitted into this world of masks and insanity perfectly - but besides a very good scene with a lot of cats it was just that ... masks and insanity. The animals were like totems, the main characters took a lot of characteristics, but they remained human.Not so in "Catwoman". Here the hero has superhuman powers, is more a female version of "The Crow", with some hightened senses from "The Sentinel", but clearly not human, not even remotely. She is fast (too fast for human muscles ever to be), incredibly agile and she even has a lot of involuntary aspects of a cat (i.e. addiction to catnip). I suppose most of the worser ratings here come from the disappointed view, that they spoiled Batman's Catwoman. Well, they didn't, it's a different breed. Unfortunately, under the screams of protest the ball came rolling and once it goes downhill in a wave of hate, the ratings really go south.If you see this movie and imagine an other title, "Bast" for example, if you do not compare it with the world of Batman, it is not *that* bad. It may not be good ... I mean ... Bast reminded strongly of the Bast of Neil Gaiman's "Sandman", and the plot, saving the world from toxic beauty products? Hey, the Joker in Batman could make *toxic* beauty products, this one ... well, no, I shouldn't compare ... anyway.It's a nice flick, not good, much to moralizing for that, certainly not bad (considered without the Batman Universe), just o.k.. Give it the benefit of doubt and make up your own judgement about it.5/10

reviews.review_title: It was a fun, stylishly sexy film about a woman, who finds out there's more fun and adventure with nine lives.
reviews.content: Catwoman shouldn't be seen as a feminist movie, but as a fun film about a woman, who finds that she's more than she thought she was. The visuals were good and so was the acting. I came to the theater with no expectation and enjoyed it because of that. It's not a deep movie and it isn't trying to be. Cat lovers Enjoy! Dog Lovers, I think you'll like this movie as well. Halle is one sexy kitten and brings a fresh feel to the character of Catwoman. She does seem to borrow certain mannerisms from past actors who played Catwomen, but she also shows that she was up to the challenge and comes across with a solid performance. The camera work was a bit over done and most of the time you could tell of the computer generated images of Catwoman doing her cat like moves. Even certain fight scenes seemed a bit awkward at times. Sharon's Stone's performance could have been better, but she was playing a vengeful, ex-model, who was being tossed aside for a younger beauty. How deep can you go when your playing a shallow character to begin with?

reviews.review_title: Never has a movie disgusted me so much
reviews.content: I have seen hundreds of movies and I admit that some weren't of the highest quality. But this movie takes the gold medal for the worst movie I've ever seen, but it sucks so much that it doesn't deserve gold, it deserves dirt. First of all the CG animation was 20 times worse that The Matrix 2, (and if anybody has seen that movie then they know bad CG work). Second, the acting was horrific. Berry is at her worst and the dude who's always on random TV shows should stay on those TV shows. This movie had some crappy casting. Thirdly, the story was bad enough that not even Goerge Bush would use the script as toilet paper. It amazes me, how can you make a movie that you know is gonna suck? I thank Jesus that i didn't waste my money on seeing this load of cow crap in the theaters. I'm just ashamed of myself for watching the whole thing at home. This movie is a 1 out of 10, because IMDb wouldn't let me vive it a 0. Catwoman sucks.

reviews.review_title: Its bad but not bottom 100 bad
reviews.content: Seriously its not that bad, with all the hype I was expecting something that a cat spit up (kind of sounds asinine that I would to see a movie to see if it actually sucks as everyone says). The worst part about this things was the CG, which just goes to show you can never spend too much on CG. It wasn't that the CG catwoman was unbelievable (although the resurrection scene was especially bad) it was just that Halle was only in the movie for about 30 min (being generous here). The plot was average, and the fight scenes were actually quite well choreographed, however the overall flick was too abrupt not giving enough time to develop any of its characters.I would say 6/10, my opinion its worth a matinée price but not a regular night price. If you have got some money your not using and are willing to suspend your disbelief through all the CG you may find it enjoyable.

CATWOMAN is a fantasy film about a beautiful but shy and awkward woman, Patience Philipps, who works as a graphic designer for Hedare Beauty. Patience is trapped in the rat race, and seems to have difficulty managing her time. But her life will change quite unexpectedly...I didn't watch the film at the cinema. I don't remember whether I was put off by bad reviews or I couldn't find time to go to the cinema. Anyway, seeing it on a TV listing a few days ago, I thought, 'Why not giving it a try?' With negative reviews, I was prepared for something awful. Yet, I wanted to check myself whether it was that bad. To my great surprise, it wasn't. Certainly, it is not rich in ideas and witty dialogs. And the plot is far from being original. Yet, the film does well what it is set out to do. There are goodies and baddies... And they do what they are supposed to do: they fight. The baddies, by the way, are less disgusting than those Batman has to fight. To put it in a nutshell, the film has all the ingredients which make Marvel's stories so popular with the audience. I was kept on the edge of my seat from start to end. The urban scenery and special effects are just breathtaking. Halle Berry's movements are a visual treat. The conclusion I draw from this experience is that the higher your expectations for the film, the more likely you're to be disappointed. Also, I can't understand why people carry high expectations for films which don't have any masterpiece pretensions.

This is very bad movie avoid at all costs. Movie is unforgivable garbage of bad story, bad writing, bad CGI and bad acting. It seems like DC is doing it on purpose because DC movies are still to this day a bad as Catwoman. Movie is forgettable. If you don't need to watch this don't if you really have to watch this and you are interested in how to make disaster of movie then watch this. But time spend on this movie is so wasted that it is mutch more interesting to watch paint dry or you can just watch in the sun so you go blind because if that happens you won't need to watch this movie again. In conclusion avoid at all costs and forget it does exist.

reviews.review_title: Marginally better than being put in front of a firing squad.
reviews.content: How to describe this movie? It's a tough question. I could go with something pictorial, like a giant pile of manure covered in a swarm of buzzing flies, or try to invoke some sort of description based upon the booing and jeering audience in the cinema when I saw this. But those would not be good enough. No, this movie left me feeling at the end of it as if it had just murdered my entire family, and then subjected me to a couple of millennia of Abu Ghraib-styled torture.Just what is it that provokes such vitriolic hatred? The movie is just flawed, from start to finish. I know from experience not to expect too much from American superhero flicks, but this makes "Batman and Robin" look like a masterpiece of modern film-making. The script is embarrassingly clichéd and bad, the cinematography is average at best, and Halle Berry's acting is about as wooden as the contents of a lumber yard. Apart from Ms Berry, all of the other actors here, mostly a collection of Hollywood wannabes and has-beens, overact to a degree that would make William Shatner blush with embarrassment.Some people might think it slightly silly that I'd take offence at going to see tripe like this, but when you think about it, the millions of dollars that were spent on the bevy of special effects in this film (an ironic term, since not a single one of them is very special at all), could have been spent on cancer research, feeding starving African children, or, perhaps my favourite, actually putting together a decent film that people will watch out of something other than a sick sense of fascination with bad cinema.

First of all let me say I did not hate this movie. Partly because I have no idea about Catwoman comics so I, in a way, saw it without any expectations. Its story is a perfect formula following almost the same pattern as that of Spider-man; which is kind of boring and even annoying. Much of stunts of the Catwoman are very similar to those of the Spider-man. Again, boring. Halle Berry did not do the bad job. Movie was written and directed bad. At times she almost amazed me with details in which she duplicated tiny movements of real cats.Just because Catwoman happens to be a woman, she doesn't need to dress extremely provocatively and her curves should not be noticed lustfully among a bunch of junior school children. Most superhero movies attract a lot of children and same could be true for this one too. Many scenes have no other purpose except focusing on Miss Berry's curves moving in an exaggerated manner; which hurts many serious movie viewers. Her Catwoman dress is unnecessarily provocative and scanty.As for fantasy, it is not bad; with a huge potential of a great story thrown in gutter. Special effects with real cats are highly detailed and almost flawless.Overall, if you have nothing else to do and you want to waist an hour and a half in a flawed fantasy, this movie is not bad.

reviews.review_title: Visually entertaining COMIC BOOK FILM! Plot OK, Music NOT so great ! NO Batman
reviews.content: But,,, what were you expecting? I SURELY would have bought $$$ rather than just rented $ , "Catwoman" if ... they had only edited / changed that silly basketball scene and re-edited the sound during the 'catwoman in action' scenes to more thematic and dramatic SCORING in place of that 'beyonce-sounding-pop-music-catwoman-theme' that was used (which i really don't mind at all 'outside' of these important scenes) this would have brought my overall rating up one point to an 8 as well.I LOVE most of the silly popcorn action movies involving superheroes, but especially Catwoman / Batman , and yes as i had expected, i see that Michelle Pheiffer will STILL remain my most beloved Catwoman EVER! There were some rumours floating about after Batman Returns (which i rate a 9 btw) came out, that she would be featured in her own Catwoman film, this of course never happened, and here we are 12 years later, with a new re-invention of this most beloved character.I like Halle Berry, I really do, I think she did a fantastic job entertaining me and being an action-hero for this film, but this is just not what i had been waiting for, really. Too light, too urban-pop, too,,,, 2004. We should have expected nothing less though. It's called the 'entertainment industry' for a reason. I paid a small amount of money and I was rather entertained, the end.Another thing, I noticed that all of the Pheiffer / Burton footage they used in the Eartha Kitt documentary really seemed to be from '92. Curious?

reviews.review_title: OMG Stay AWAY! Worst movie in history of man kind!
reviews.content: Oh my god First of all let me start with one thing: The Cat Woman is not Afro-American. I see a few people talking about an alternative Afro Cat Woman from the Comics as well as from an old TV series; OK, so, let me explain to you people: Spider Man had six arms, became evil, died, resurrected, was black in an alternative reality, was a woman and so many other ALTERNATIVES, but Spider-Man, the original character from the Amazing Spider-Man comic book is brown haired, blue eyed skinny looking guy, the other versions lasted for ONE comic book only as an alternative deal, that is it period. It does not make him Afro-American in any way, so, don't do a movie about it. The very same thing happens with Cat Woman  she had alternative stuff, but the original character IS a foxy Blonde Blue Eyed woman. Once the director and casting crew decided to change that, they lost millions of fans including me. It is a stab in the back, a betrayal worthy of trial! Don't mess with the originality of an ancient character, please, don't ever do that again.Now, lets just say the idea of a Cat Woman movie is cool nonetheless, so I did managed to watch it, I am a fan of her (Cat) after all. After ten minutes of watching, I noticed I had a pain head and realized I was going to regret renting this for my entire life, and when the movie ended I did.Halle Berry is pretty? Sure, but is she as beautiful as a Blonde Blue Eyed woman? Hell no, and I noticed this movie needed a foxy blonde, it hell needed it a lot and Halle did not manage to replace it, not in a million years. Again, the Cat woman is Blonde Blue Eyed, so, when you change that, you kill the best feature of the movie. Don't listen to the very few people who say the "blonde" type is a 2k stereotype, old stuff I am sorry but it is not, if the Cat Woman was Blonde I am sure this one would get at least a 6 from me.Everyone wants to see a foxy Blonde in a costume like that; now you take that away... You simply have nothing interesting, period. OK, so, enough with the blonde deal, lets say you are a fan of Halle Berry, cool; you can see her as the Cat Woman. Don't even dream amigo! Even if you CAN manage to tolerate her presence (Impossible to me ever since she boycotted the X-Men 2 and 3 because she is "An Oscar Winner... boohoos"), you still have the worst movie ever made in history of man kind at your television. Why is the worst of all? Because of Halle and Sharon acting as well as everything else.I find this very disturbing because the director or "I don't know who else" actually thought that the mere presence of Halle would be enough to make it look good, and again this proved that I am right about her "not deserving her Oscar", because her acting in this movie was the worst in history of man kind. I have never seen anything like IT in my entire life. I am not joking, if you watch this movie, you will notice that Halle makes some strange faces as if she was acting in a blue screen or as if she was staring into the "void" the entire movie, looking like a robot or "retard" woman. The lack of a decent acting is so disturbing that you will start to feel like watching one of those tapes your own kids do at home. The other reasons are the lack of special effects, good fighting scenes, action, good sound effects and the most important of all: A Story. I don't know what went wrong in there, it is not the low budget  just check The Punisher, the lowest budget movie ever made and yet it looks so amazing, the actors did a superb job  So, maybe it was the presence of the short haired Sharon Stone (Someone should tell her, she is looking like a dude) who lacked to fish the blonde lovers like me, or it was the painful acting of them both, or the fact that they changed the ethnicity of one of the coolest female characters of the comic book, leaving us only Elektra and the Wonder Woman as a "true to the fans" crossover. It is a pity that an Oscar winner like Halle acted so badly, disturbingly I am starting to think she never deserved the statue, as it was not her first bad job, just go and see her on X-Men 3, she had a terrible performance as well  Maybe she is falling in her career, who knows? For your own sake, don't bother for this one, even if you are a fan; seriously, there is nothing to see there, other than a pain head.

reviews.review_title: Not bad as they go in the comic book genre
reviews.content: Let me sign on with the large crew who thought this movie got mugged. If anyone thinks Lex Luthor or the four-armed mad scientist of Spidey2 are emanations of superior imagination, maybe there are literary secrets I should go sit at someone's feet to learn. I have a feeling a few of the disappointed are seeking enlightenment or some really stirring fare for the soul in comic book excursions. Again,it may be that Peter Parker is a more comfortable model for some of the critics and viewers than the indomitable and very puissant lady here. (After all, Hallie after she puts on her "suit" doesn't get utterly trashed or even scratched much the way Uma did in "Kill Bill".) Another group, possibly, grew up on the classic tale, and has typical xenophobia about a new kid on the block. For the record, I thought the setup -- the opening graphics of a series of mystic catwomen -- and I confess to never having read the original -- was intriguing, in fact one of the nicest opener-under-credits I've seen. Hallie was very nice, she had fine changes of expression, her motions synchronized perfectly with the role, she had all the requisite grace and ability of the Award Winner. The script was standard light and certainly not less than the wildly untalented "Superman One," which, after the opening with Brando, written by Mario Puzo of the "Godfather", degenerated into something almost painful to watch. All in all, this was not a bad little effort.

I had successfully avoided watching Catwoman for the last 22 years, but tonight while mildly impaired I saw it was on TV and decided to give it a go. I had heard various things about how bad it was, but this is even worse than I thought it would be.With the production quality of a daytime TV drama made for tweens, Catwoman disappoints in every way. A soundtrack that sounds like it was generated by the local band who never get airplay anywhere else than their town's community radio station only helps intensify the cheesy fight sequences and romance scenes. Lacklustre costumes, effects and sets serve to further disappoint the viewer. The actors are practically radiating self-loathing with the delivery of every line, and no one can blame them, considering the script flows like a 16 year old girl's Twilight fanfiction. The filmmakers themselves even seem to have given up on it by the end, as a character plunges from a building and cuts to an extremely obvious jointless, plush dummy hurtling with nearly flapping limbs through the air.I was not high enough for Catwoman not to affect me and in fact I wonder if that's even possible.

Since this movies conception, there have been numerous references to Michelle Pfeiffer's Catwoman in the 1992 classic Batman Returns. 2004's Catwoman has absolutely nothing to do with either Batman, his villains, nor any resemblance to that Catwoman character. Questions have been raised wondering whether Halle Berry could fill the same role as Pfeiffer. Well, in my opinion, no. The depth of acting it took for this incarnation was more geared to martial arts and being sexy in leather. Don't take it wrong, Halle Berry, an excellent actress, wasn't given any true depth of character to work with. The movie seems to be divided into halves. The first part deals with Patience Philips working for a cosmetic company as an art designer who just can't seem to get anything right when it comes to her boss. What began promising at first, turned into a disaster when Catwoman finally arrived about 40 minutes into the film. This second half lost the story with a barrage of leaps and fights mixed with a loose love story.There are a few resemblances to Batman Returns, and maybe these were a nod to it:1. Halle Berry turns towards the camera, crouched delivering the same Meow! as Pfeiffer's character.2. Catwoman, always letting her curiosity rule, goes into a store, where instead of meeting 2 security guards as Pfeiffer's did, she meets 3 robbers.3. Catwoman stands in front of the moon.4. Catwoman nearly falls out the window, and later on, is almost pushed out the window.The references are there, but for anyone who hasn't seen Batman Returns, you wouldn't notice them. There are a few more nods, but I think the point is delivered.So, what's this story all about? Well, if anyone has seen the trailer to Resident Evil: Apocalypse, then you would have the story in a nutshell. In the trailer to RE2 (due this Fall) there's a facial cream that rots your skin and its side effects are toxic. (Funny, I was reminded as well of The Jokers mixture of poisonous toxins he shipped from his factory to shelves in 1989's Batman.) OK, we have the fired employee who is killed because she found out about the evil corporations secret. A cat performs CPR (or so that's what it looks like), and she comes back to life. There isn't a comic book villain in this movie, ala Joker, Penguin, or Doc Ock (Spider-Man 2). What we have is the ruthless and completely flat corporate executives. There's no depth to these villains and no clever schemes to nab Catwoman, only pin a few deaths on her. There's your story ladies and gentlemen and I think you can pretty much figure out how it turns out.In the beginning, there was so much promise. From the opening credits showing the origins of cats in myth and legend to the meeting she has with the owner of Midnight (the cat who performed CPR.) After that, it was a downhill spiral. I will say that the catsuit was nice and very revealing, however the headpiece looks really odd. Catwoman got her claws from Tiffany's I think (they really do look like designer nails).I have to say, in all fairness, that Catwoman in Batman Returns was a lot more real and the character had a purpose. From her stitched up suit to her makeshift claws. Some may think I was going into this movie with a preception of Catwoman from Batman, but I did not. I had followed this movie since it was first announced and knew it was not the same. I also knew it had nothing to do with the Dark Knight, but I did expect one thing...a good story for the money. Halle Berry is better than a walkthrough part and deserves a good script, she's proven herself as a fine actress. Nothing is really explained in the movie and it's loosely tied together between action sequences and sex appeal.To see, or not to see, that is the question. The answer is up to you.

There are so many moments in this film when the music was telling me to be scared, excited, or in awe, but during those moments I was laughing hysterically. Notably, the sequence where Seline Kyle (sorry 'Patience') is brought back to life. The music was blaring to signify a wondrous turning point, but the CG was so obvious and the cat breathing cat-breath on her was so silly I didn't buy it, and hardly bought anything afterward either. Also Hallie I think is just not that good an actor. She's a looker, and tries very very hard, but just can't play anything more convincingly then a tough girl. There were some nice character moments, but a lot of them were very weird. Catwoman's powers make little sense, and her compulsions played up as heroic are NOT admirable. When did assault, vandalism, rudeness and sexual promiscuity become things to be encouraged? Originally Patience's character is pathetically nerdy to the point of being a parody, but her transformation into an over-sexed, animal always struck me as a bad thing, almost like she was being possessed by an evil entity. Her eventual transformation from thief to crime- fighter seems like an afterthought, and this is largely what makes the film feel empty. We never get to know Patience, and Catwoman keeps changing what she is. So overall the ideas are here for an interesting story, the characters are pretty interesting (except for the main character) and the art direction and cinematography are all interesting throughout, but the writing can dip into pure silliness (how dramatically can someone say 'Catnip'?) and the story dissolves into nonsense approaching the end and some things simply don't mesh, and the moral is confused and ridiculous ('Freedom is power???') Not terrible through lack of caring, but it is rendered impotent by taking itself too seriously.

reviews.review_title: This film is not as bad as everyone is making out, there are a couple of plus points
reviews.content: The cat-woman film changes D.C comics mythology by suggesting that there have been countless Catwomen through the ages Selina kyle was just one off them. Patience Phillips is the contemporary take on it.I think the 'raters' are being a bit harsh with this one, there are a large amount of flaws but there are also a few plus points. First lets look at the flaws, OK well this may take a while cause there are a few so i think i will just look at the main ones. 1. the script isn't great, there were a couple of moments when i kind of cringed for instance when Hallie berry walks up to a glass door (bearing in mind its glass totally transparent so she is able to see through it) an says ' is anybody there'. there were a number of moments like this when i thought 'not to quick on the up check are u patience. 2. There is a total lack of mismatch in the villain department , cat-woman is like this karate cat thing then she is basically up against someone with really hard skin. 3. this is the biggest one for me Hallie's best friend in this movie is so annoying, when ever this lady speaks all that exits her mouth is a barrage of MTV style sentence's, she also seems to delusional think she is a fine honey, and continuously gives Hallie Berry advice on how to pull men. OK thats the most annoying things on the up side: 1. Halle is awesome as cat-woman, she is sexy and confident and i don't think many other actresses could have been as good as she was taking into account the films main falling point. 2. some of the fight scenes were quite cool, I think it was corpora the Brazilian form of martial arts she was performing, don't get me wrong, i don't know much about that kind of thing though so i may be mistaken. 3. OK the cgi wasn't brilliant but it was not as bad as previously made out. OK thats all i can think of at the moment so i will wrap it up. if you like Hallie berry watch this film, if you are an OPEN MINDED comic fan give it ago. if you are after an hour and a half of not so serious entertainment with an attractive lead and a tenuous romantic relationship give it a go. If you are a comic fan boy or are after a serious film steer clear my rating 5.5 out of ten not great but if there is nothing on or Ur a man with a lonely night ahead of you give it a look

Catwoman is not nearly as bad as many others make it out to be. Halle Berry is a phenomenal actress and she was true to the role of Catwoman. I read the reviews before watching the movie and was fully convinced the movie was horrible. I figured I would turn it off when it got too bad. 20 minutes into the movie I found myself liking it. Some cited awkwardness as a reason for hating it. Patience is SUPPOSED to be awkward. She's shy and lacks self confidence. Catwoman is annoying or acts badly? That's just her cheesy one liners which all Catwomen have. Cheesy one liners or puns are a STAPLE of Catwoman. Even Eartha Kitt had the one liners. Restricted door left opened? True but it was at a perfume factory. Patience needed to deliver her work by midnight or she would get fired. Was the movie perfect? Nope but it was decent. 3 negatives for me.There are a few scenes that made me dizzy. Basketball court scene had me on the verge of nausea due to motion. Some of the scenes where she was scampering around the walls were hard on my vertigo.Sharon's acting was okay at the beginning but I noticed her acting went downhill when she shared scenes with Catwoman. Now, good news first: The movie isn't *entirely* bad. One might even find a few positive points. If one looks hard enough, that is.Personally, I'd say that one good point, at least, is the cast. All actors seem intent to do the best with what little the script offered them. Which - and this is where we get started on the bad points - isn't much. Believable characters are a seriously endangered species in Catwoman:Take your average, but beautiful female loser with a boring daytime job and about as much assertiveness as an empty glass of water, then provide her with superpowers and a whip. Next, choose the love interest: a good-looking guy with an honorable job and the drive to prove his perfection in every situation, especially if that situation is dangerous. Then, we need the best friend: not all that attractive, not all that interesting, selfless in pushing the heroine towards the love interest (despite crushing on that love interest, too). The villain is the walking, talking clichée of a bitter, middle-aged woman trapped in an unhappy marriage who thus gives up on all feelings and goes strictly for the money. Her husband is really just the typical asshole boss who cheats on his wife and spends the rest of his time yelling at employees.Meet the main characters of Catwoman! Hurrah!Sadly, it doesn't get much better. The plot is ridiculous; the special effects look like special effects; Catwoman's outfit appears to have been bought in a cheap s & m leather shop; and more than just a few points are made with a sledgehammer and make me wonder just how stupid the movie creators think we are. Hopefully not as stupid as the love interest aka Tom Lone, who doesn't recognize his poorly disguised girlfriend even as she's kissing him.Overall, the movie might have been tolerable had it not relied quite as much on the sex appeal of its main actress. As it is, it leaves you with a bad aftertaste and the sound of a splashing whip that you'd expect from late-night channel surfing rather than from a movie that allegedly wants to appeal to young female moviegoers. Wasted money, but it might be fun to rent for a movie night with some friends and a lot more beer.

This is by no means a good film, but i can think of many worse ways to spend a couple of hours - as far as bad films go, at least this one is in no way pretentious or boring.OK so it is stupid (since when do cats know how to do kung fu/basketball /breakdancing/whip wielding/running up walls?) and the fight scenes are nothing but a series of incomprehensible fast cuts (presumably this was cheaper than sending Halle Berry on an intensive Kung Fu training course), but the actors and director do a reasonable job, and the film at least looks expensive.The one thing i really don't understand is who came up with the plot in the first place. What superheroes need is a good super villain. And since comic book movies (particularly comic book movies starring Halle Berry in a revealing leather costume) are presumably mainly aimed at a male audience, who on earth thought that a couple of executives at a cosmetics company would make good bad guys? So the concept of the film was flawed from the start, but in my opinion i don't think that justifies the vitriol this film seems to attract..

I'm not a big fan of comic books and I don't really like super-whatnot comics. So I'm not an ardent Catwoman fan - which may help to keep my perspective neutral.I didn't really like this movie but it wasn't so much for Halle Berry's acting or the performance of any of the other actors. Personally I think Halle did a pretty good job. She was naive and insecure when being "normal" and she became sexy and self-assure when she was Catwoman. Can't fault her there. I think we all agree that she played the normal part very well - the differences in the perception of her performing skills come, when the Catwoman part is concerned. Whether you like her version of Catwoman then depends probably on how you'd like Catwoman to be. For me - who has never given a thought about that - she played well. If you're thinking along the lines of a "real" Criminal who enjoys her crimes and who is also cruel ... well, you may be disappointed by Halle Berry's much tamer approach.There are a couple of things, however, which are pretty bad and ultimately manage to drag this movie down - no matter the quality of the actors.The thing I found most annoying is the camera work. Three seconds this angle ... three seconds that angle ... after three seconds yet another angle. This constant change of the camera angle is making it incredibly difficult to get into the movie. Try to watch this on fast forward and you'll go nuts. Scene and angle changes are nice and sometimes necessary - one can overdo things, however, and this is horribly overdone.If you're familiar with the Catwom comic character and have formed an opinion for yourself how she should be ... you'd probably be better off avoiding this movie. If you haven't formed an opinion yet you have a chance of enjoying this one - if you manage to ignore the frenzied camera angle changes.

reviews.review_title: Doesn't deserve the stick it got
reviews.content: The infamous reviews from this particular title are more well known than the movie itself, as 'Catwoman' truly crashed and burned at it's release in 2004, both critically and commercially. However, I respect that it wasn't exactly a picture if marvel, but was it really that horrific?      Personally, I really do not think it was, and I believe that many who claim to hate this title, merely just jumped on the bandwagon in a hope of looking intelligent. I really do realise that it isn't exactly good, and many aspects would drastically need to be altered, such as the following:      Firstly, as a huge comic and more specifically Batman fan, Warner Bros did have to realise that by creating a comic book adaptation, their main target audience and more importantly domestically paying audience, would be  (wait for it) the comic book fans. For example, people will pay to see Selina Kyle, in a Gotham city based escapade. But we got Patience Phillips in some hi-tech LA or something or other. That's not what the audience wants to see, it sparks the question, who are they aiming this at?      As well as this, the storyline was a bit weak; killer beauty creme? Not exactly the works of a great mastermind, let's be serious. The plot was all over the place and a bit weird, making it hard to link onto one part of the story.      And lastly, the acting. Halle Berry sparked as the cat, but simmered as the girl. Her performance was absolutely cringy in some places, but she still did have her moments.      Okay, rant over. Now to shed some praise on the poor thing.      The effects were great, and the action sequences were fun and exciting. I do think that, that was nicely done indeed, especially with the cat like movements of Halle Berry jumping around, and the camera angles were impressive too. I also think that the sticky RandB music created a svelte mood whenever Catwoman walked onto screen, and it really helped spice up the on screen action too.     So, overall, we have a movie far from perfect, but also far from terrible, which is why I've given it a 5, because it really is slap bang in the middle. It's nothing special, but it's not disastrous.

I was entertained by this movie.  I don't think it can compete with the top of the line 'Comics' movies but it is better than most of those Batman sequels.  I don't have any knowledge of the Catwoman character beyond the Batman sagas, in which she is a villain, but this movie tried to spin a typical superhero yarn.  There may be lots of criticisms of the genesis of our fair hero, but what superhero does not have an origin that stretches the imagination.  I was interested to see what powers the Catwoman would have and found it to be evenly done and not over the top.  Hey if I can buy Toby Maguire shooting web from his wrists and leaping through the metropolis, I can accept Halle Berry displaying super agility, balance and leaping prowess. I will presume that her strength comes from her superhuman speed and agility. Okay, I'm giving lots of margin but I usually do in this type of movie. They tried to integrate the characteristics of a cat in her personality. I have never owned or lived around a cat, so I can't really judge about that. Hmmm, what personality characteristics do spiders possess? I guess Spiderman writers just left that alone. You can't take this movie, like the others, too seriously. Yep, I can haggle about the Catsuit--not practical at all, but I never was too sure about the whole superheroes in tights thing anyway. It's standard issue. And given the camp of the movie, why not incorporate a Julie Newmar, Lee Merriweather and/or Ertha Kit cameo! I don't know if they are all still alive.
Benjamin Bratt holds his own not reaching far from his Law and Order ways. Sharon Stone got her b-on as a villain with 'thick skin'. The Merovingian was up to his old ways, stepping out on the wife. I was waiting for him to step through the door stage right. MAD TV was in the house.  And Halle Berry does a credible job as the sassy lassie in leather. The movie tries to cover a lot of ground in a very short time which heightens the difficulty in accepting it all especially since I know little of the history if there is one.  But I think kids can get some true enjoyment out of this one.  They tried to keep it on that level and succeeded.
