Sharon Stone's character's comment (oh yes another soft porn element -- Sharon Stone!) that she was pushed out as soon as she turned forty caused me to choke on my popcorn. Her bio claims that she was born in 1958, making her 46. But that woman looked to me to be every bit of 50.Oh and I should not forget the last soft porn element: the extended catfight. This one should go straight to late night on Skinemax.My rating: 1/2 out of 5 (every effort even bad one deserve some credit).

reviews.review_title: Catwoman was entertaining! Well worth the admission fee!
reviews.content: I loved the whole premise of this movie. Halle Berry was convincing as a cat woman. Benjamin Bratt was great as the cop--just like MISS CONGENIALITY. Not enough scenes with Sharon Stone..though..she's always a good villain! As a cat lover, I loved all the felines too! I was entertained throughout the picture...Not the least bored or dissatisfied by the story! I'm only interested in being entertained not by just the art! I hope there will be a sequel! Anyone that likes to have fun will enjoy this catwoman. Most people who don't like this show obviously don't enjoy cats. CATWOMAN will definitely be one of my favorites this year. I definitely was not disappointed will this movie and I hope it makes a lot of movie so that CATWOMAN 2 is in our theaters next year!!!!

reviews.review_title: Actually, fulfilling movie, for a comic book character
reviews.content: Why all the negativity? The movie was based on a comic book character, one of many possible origins of "Catwoman", one of Batman's opponents. I thought Halle pulled off the performance fairly well. What does everyone expect? The plot was simple, yes. But, I didn't see huge logic holes either, if you stuck to their "universe". Admittedly, special effects were a little substandard considering the technology of today, but it wasn't a major issue for me. Basically, it was an enjoyable movie with a straightforward plot, where one could suspend reality, sit back and thoroughly enjoy Halle Berry's portrayal of a classic Batman comic book character.

reviews.review_title: Hello, CATwoman, of course it was lame.
reviews.content: Some super heros are just lame and no amount of video-vixening will change that.  Aqua Man.  The Wonder Twins.  Robin without Batman.  And CATwoman: with the powers of not even a tiger or lioness, but a house cat.  And the whip.  What's with the whip?  Why not give her a rolled up newspaper or a spray can of CAT-mace?  Even if Indiana Jones made a whip cool on film, it was never something that carried menace.  It's a tool, at best, not something that empowers a comic book hero.  Growing up, no kid ever pretends to be Catwoman or one of the Wonder Twins.  But no complaints.  The poster and trailer said it all: the actress who gets paid a million an exposed boob (see- Swordfish) in a PG-13 sex teaser mostly for teenagers with disposable summer income.  That's entertainment.  Spiderman 2 had Oscar and Pulitzer winners at the writing helm, but it's a fluke.  Every other comic book to film project stuck to the images.  So go easy on Halle as the large domestic feline.  It's eye-candy, not a gourmet meal.

I watched this film in German, so at least I was spared the worst of the dialogue. Having said that, the dubbed dialogue was appalling too. Why did I go in the first place? Basically, because I had an afternoon to kill, and Halle Berry looked good on the poster. We all make mistakes! The plot is so ludicrous that there's nothing to spoil. Sharon Stone with a concrete face was amusing but come on scriptwriter - what were you smoking? Berry's transformation from frump to S&M dominatrix was totally unconvincing. OK - she inherited cat-like strength and agility, but why would she suddenly be able to pull off martial arts moves? The costume is clearly aimed at men in dirty raincoats, and the silly pouting look just didn't work. I actually thought she looked far better as the frump - she is after all a naturally-beautiful woman.Since both Ms. Berry and Ms. Stone have made much better films (Monsters Ball and Casino for example), I guess we can forgive them for going for an easy paycheck, but really this is one of the worst films I ever saw. If cinemas still showed second features, this would struggle to be the second; the commercials would be better value for money!

Catwoman is now part of the divx empire with floating borders, managed by supermarkets, DVD-rentals, and more ephemeral torrents and watch-on-line sites. Is it still worth your time to sit down and see this picture on your flat-screen, your PC, media-center or wait for a sequel? Well, this movie was modeled on the pedestal of a famous comic, Batman, and despite the fine cast and the good camera-work this picture seems even less convincing after six years. But hey, anyone who wants to see a beautiful power-woman will not gain himself a raw deal by buying or renting this picture. Its much, much better than the sleazy Youtube do-it- yourself seduce stuff. Anyway, after Avatar and Superman hit the box-office you should be careful as to your expectations regarding animation. It is not up to present day accomplishment and standards. Why is it, that despite the casting, this picture never became a hit? The actors are great. Sharon Stone is a very cold marble-iced beauty-queen, Laurel Hedare, who is really the boss of Hedare cosmetics, while her husband, George, is not much of a real man. He is CEO of Hedare beauty products. George Hedare is being played by Lambert Simon and is a whithering bore who fascinates young women. It turns out he wants them brainless and not to toy with, but he goes out and eats with them and watch boring ballet stuff. These women really do follow this 'ego-maniac'. And he wants to show them off like his car with driver, flashing the message, I am a great virile guy. He doesn't seem to be, at least Laurel claims. Well, perhaps he is a 'gay sandwich', who simply married to Laurel who is dissatisfied with life (and with her sex-life I assumed after hearing some of her remarks). Share stone is acting a person who is a living statue that kills anyone who gets in her way. Still a beautiful woman, this George Hedare cannot tell a woman when he sees one.But the real heroine of this picture is Patience, alias Catwoman, who is played by Hale Berry. She won an academy award for her leading role in Monster's Ball some time a go. The camera-work of catwoman is great, the animation is not bad, but the heroine was badly served by the scenario-writer Rebeck who mixed in nineteenth century Gothic with Stargate philosophy, Batman's tongue in the cheek humor, and a sort of Mary Jane Parker obsession, for as Catwoman's lover Tom is being threatened Catwoman rescues him. She is at times a nice and compulsory girl, who wants to please others, can't stand up for herself, a real do-gooder. At the opening of the picture a voice reveals Patience was killed. It later turns out for being at the wrong time and at the wrong place. But as the picture starts we know she is still very much alive, well, alive as a dualistic personality, who is caring in a very careless manner. Catwoman's adagio is freedom after the image of modern witchery. She was really made after the image Dion Fortune, a worshiper of Pan, projected into culture as a high-priestess of boundless individuality, with a strong tactile sense and sensuality. Making love to Catwoman hurts, Tom finds out in this picture, his back shows scratches. The philosophy of the makers have turned Catwoman really into a picture that belongs to a period of the last decade, and predating the financial crises. In the decade gone by ethics were merely serving our lust for freedom, or our freedom to lust. So, in the end catwoman does not care a damn about her Tom, but only wants her freedom to do good and to do bad, whenever she likes. That is hardly a program to win the hearts and minds of the viewers. Anyone who is been in a true relation knows that whimsical does not work and annoys eventually to the point of decay. The writer of this story Theresa Rebeck forgot her reality-basics. And the guy shooting the fights had to much choreography in his mind. Well, I like Margot Fonteyn and have been watching Ballanchine, and saw Rudi van Dantzig and Hans van Maanen companies in theaters, but this was too way too much for me, a girl dancing her blows. Is that serious..? Lethal weapon 4 with its martial arts altercations was more convincing in this respect. But boys and girls, if you like romance, virility, lust and beauty served on a plate, it is yours, if you are still going take this picture from a shelf in a DVD-shop. Okay, it is food on a paper plate, you get a bit of burger chewing and no high brow stuff, but on the good side: your not out on the streets doing other mischief. I think it is a shame the writer did not do Hale a better service; Rebeck should read up on her Aristotle, his Poetics and Rherotics, and about mixing improbable story lines and the plausibility of characters. In the end I thought Stone would be a marvelous villain in a new Dalmatians picture.. Improbably bad, lustful languishing bad... just beautiful. In the end Catwoman went for freedom.. a message that liked to imply the idea of a sequel, but also presented the message that Catwoman was perhaps just another egomaniac who goes for sex in the city, one night stands, and self-gain. That really killed the picture and Hale's projection of more sensitive character parts.

reviews.review_title: It's weird, but I like it.
reviews.content: Catwoman is a film that few can appreciate. Largely due to the fact that it is nearly unwatchable. However, if you enjoy a good cringefest of a film then Catwoman is definitely for you. An unintentional comedy for the ages that will leave you laughing in tears. It should be noted that in order to experience this euphoric plethora of gut-busting laughter, you will be forced to submit to this film's ridiculousness. If you try to resist this films insanity then you will release tears of sadness instead of tears of laughter. I recommend this "film" only to those that will not bother trying to take it seriously.

reviews.review_title: A must for lovers of halle berry, but hard to stay awake!
reviews.content: Well in fact all is said in my oneliner, I saw it last week on a cd bought on the beach. But to be true I remember only the appearance of halle berry and benjamin brat in oprha's show and forgot already details and storyline of the movie.While most good movies I have seen I can predict second by second, sentences and actions I hardly remember anything of this movie.The average is now 2.9 this in my opinion is not deserved but morethan a -5 I cannot vote for this movie.The worst is what I do remember of this movie, the special effects seeing catwoman strutt her stuff, clearly showing a cartoonimage whereas halle berry only appears in closeups and standing/walking actions.

reviews.review_title: An enjoyable Movie that can be watched several times
reviews.content: Just watched Catwoman for the 2.5th time and it is still a Movie I enjoy watching. I noticed now the extra material on the DVD talking about older versions and then saw on IMDb, that some people didn't like it. If you take the film critically apart, well, some cat walking seems a bit overacted and the building jumps looks very similar to Spidermans CGI's, but which Movie is completely perfect....Although I used to read a lot of DC Superhero Comics when I was young, I didn't get to much of Catwoman than as occasional guest in some Batman Episodes, so her original motivation and background isn't to much known by me, so that I don't miss anything. Other Comics made to Movies have been worse made, than this one. What I specially liked, is the mystic and esoteric background of the cats mentioned. How's about making two more films..... I would at least watch them at the Cinema and also buy the DVD.

reviews.review_title: Dumb idea in the first place!
reviews.content: Anyone who gave this film MORE than 2 stars needs their head examined, and those who did give it 2 stars should be carefully watched! This film sucked! I mean, it defies belief that the thing got made in the first place. The story was pants, the effects were rubbish and the whole thing was just pointless. This is the worst film i've seen since feardotcom which was really bad! Catwoman is such a weak character on her own and only really has any meaning or relevance when she is in the Batman world. That's where she should've stayed because ultimately that's where the film began to crumble, right at the concept stage! The decision to seemingly sever all links with Batman was a monumental mistake by the producers of this movie, and gave it no foundation whatsoever. A very poor film born of a very poor idea...

Worst superhero film ever made and it's not even close. Halle Berry herself knows how terrible her performance was and gladly accepted her Razzie award. It's hard to imagine that anyone thought this was a good way to give Catwoman her own story. We've had two versions of Catwoman since this abomination and both of them put this mockery of the character to shame. Plus let's face it, nobody will ever live up to Michelle Pfeiffer's iconic portrayal, she captured lightning in a bottle with her legendary live-action Catwoman. Even Jared Leto's Joker seems like Oscar-worthy material compared to Halle Berry's Catwoman. This film has definitely set the bar for how awful a comic book movie can get.

reviews.review_title: This was a good movie.. Just not quite hater proof..
reviews.content: This is the problem with "you people" that expect everything to be wrapped up the way YOU want it. You probably didn't even pay attention, you just went through criticizing it.If you'd been paying attention then you would know the lore created by Bob Kane, the creator of Batman- and thus this spin off, was that Patience was only one of many Catwomen. So she indeed was a Catwoman- like Selina Kyle. As for Marble-face, could have been much better I agree but this film contained all the classic dynamics of Superhero flick, not to mention she was the sexiest thing ever in a costume. The feel of this film harkened sort of a pre Dark Knight from a woman prospective. The storyline was decent and that of an introductory film with character you would not mind getting to know further.Sorry you waited 12 years for a Spin off with Michelle Pfeiffer, I liked her too- but you should take that up with her and the studio. Watch the film a second time- this time without the chip on your shoulder.

reviews.review_title: If you were expecting Citizen Kane, then you deserve to be disappointed...
reviews.content: Alright, so this movie wasn't a classic.  It wasn't even all that great. Still, for someone who walked into the theater expecting a big pile of stinkiness, it was surprisingly entertaining.  The action kept me interested, and Halle's performance made me think that she had a lot of fun with this role.  I'm not even going to bother explaining anything to the comic book geeks who have already made their point more than clear, but for the rest of us  just looking for an air conditioned, popcorn-filled night of pure action sequences and corny one-liners, this movie delivered.  So lighten up.  At least it didn't have a ridiculously over-the-top villain (*cough* Spiderman *cough*). Or Kirsten Dunst, for that matter (shudders). Top 100 material this is not, but it doesn't belong in the bottom 100 either.

This movie is soooooooo good. Wow, almost on the level on Kangaroo Jack, but not quite as good.  Anyways, like I did during Kangaroo Jack, I soiled my pants.  Just, I don't like how Catwoman has a nemisis that isn't an animal, she should be fighting Dogman.  Kangaroo's are racist animals, so they couldn't use that. I know this film will break all the box office records set by the Passion this year, and it should because the Passion was also racist.  Anyways, mad props to Hallie Berry, but I would've liked to have seen some white chocolate in that custome. I like the white women.    Uggh I like it like that, slow motion fo me.  The mask was incredible, it reminded me of Shredder from Ninja Turtles.  I think that the performance is on par with Busta Rhymes performance in the critically acclaimed Holloween Ressurection.  I bet Catwoman cooks some mean Nachos.

Story moves forward quickly...this character has lots of power and energy...when she dispatches someone....the plot lurks inside the scene....the character doesn't really understand herself yet, and is subject to be misled...but she gets it on, and and is a wonder to behold...the skin tones in this film alone are worth the dough to see it...the director also worked on Alien 4, I believe, and is a class act...I wouldn't miss seeing his work.... The score is super hip for this film, and really opens the scenes with Halley....all in all, a great romp with fun all over it...and the sexiest film I've ever seen.....I went to Virgin to get the soundtrack, and it is unavailable....that's insane....by the way..the titles are fabulous in the film....

Like many others, I had my doubts about the movie known as Catwoman. The previews alone almost made me vomit numerous times, and I couldn't ever picture myself actually going to see the movie. But on one rainy day, my life partner managed to drag me to the movie. I didn't realize it at the time, but my life was going to change forever. Catwoman was that darn good. I don't know how many people can honestly say they ever saw a movie that seriously changed them, but now I can truthfully say that about Catwoman. In all of my years on this planet, I don't think I'll ever be as touched or as moved as I was that fateful day. Catwoman gave me hope to lead a better life, and I'm already on the right path.Simply put, Catwoman is a work of art. The people who are insulting it obviously have no taste in movies. Catwoman may never receive the credit and respect it deserves, but I at least know that I appreciate it. And in my opinion, that is all that matters.

reviews.review_title: Critics still embarrassed after dissing the Monster's Ball !
reviews.content: The critics seemed determined to undermine Halle's attempts after being proved wrong in Monster's Ball.I thought the movie was worth watching and I've talked to a lot of people that enjoyed it.I read one review that said what's Oscar winner Halle Berry doing in a movie like this?Well did Marlon Brando ever play Jor-el?Did Gene Hackman ever play Lex Luthor?How about Faye Dunaway?Peter O'Toole?Cliff Robertson?Who have all played in Super-hero movies.Actors appear in movies like these because they are fun and they try to be entertaining and aim at escapism.They are a change of pace role and give them a chance to try something different.Critics seem intent to criticize movies like this and recommend some highly artistic dry movie that I just absolutely hate and can't get into to watching at all.SO very often the big money makers of the year is some movie that the critics dislike but they wouldn't be making money unless the general public does like them.This movie is not a dud like some critics want to say.It has a lot to offer and a lot of people who do see it are going to enjoy it.

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as it's made out to be
reviews.content: How do I put it? This is one of those movies that's so bad it's good. Kinda along the same line as Showgirls. Sure the effects have aged horribly and the script is crap but it's enjoyable enough if you don't take it seriously and enjoy it for the campy film it's maybe unintentional become. I don't know what happened but they really screwed up Catwoman's story. They had all the pieces there with Michelle Pfeiffer's Catwoman to make a good movie, yet somehow it morphed into this. Thank God it didn't end here for the DC superhero movies. You could tell the talent was way better than the material they were given to work with. And you can't say they didn't have any talented people attracted to the movie because Halle Berry, Benjamin Bratt, Sharon Stone and Alex Borstein are all talented in their own special ways. This movie also seemed like it was rushed into production way to quick because there as some things off about both the script and special effects. But I think this movie is hugely exaggerated on how bad it is. It's not a bad movie but it isn't great. I would recommend this as rental but if you can find it for cheap on sale or watch it for free it's worth a look over

reviews.review_title: Move over James Cameron, Pitof has arrived!
reviews.content: When will people listen to the great Earl Dittman? (American film critic) He calls Catwoman a "pulse pounding 100% action thrill ride!" and he's right! Pitof is set to become the next Spielberg, I'm not kidding! Earl Dittman is the one sane man in a world gone mad. he is the only voice of  reason, like Moses before him, he will lead us to the cinematic promised land. Why don't people believe him? Why is he labeled a fool? He is trying to tell us about great movies people! He should be thanked! Yes I went to see the movie with my 5 year old cousin and yes it IS as great as everyone is saying. Having a skin cream that causes your face to fall off is really scary!  Pitof will go on to one of the most best film careers ever! Hollywood  in my eyes has never made a bad movie, they are incapable of making a bad movie. They are so smart. People think they want a story and character development and jokes and stuff, but that's BORING! All we want is relentless fast cuts and loud pop tunes with a sexy chick strutting around and Hollywood did it again. Bravo! I can't wait to see it again. Thank you Earl Dittman,  your glowing review got me to see Catwoman and you saved me, and gave me a great gift! And that hat Catwoman wears? Genius! It has OSCAR written all over it for best costume design! Look out James Cameron, Pitof has arrived! Bravo Earl Dittman!

Innocence to devil. Um yea - the style list for Sharon Stone, MMMM nailed it.

reviews.review_title: Not the worst movie of all times!
reviews.content: OK, this one is not easy to review. Lots of critics have been accused this one of being the worst movie of all times. I do understand the hype about worst movies, because I think these awards are more or less for "the most disappointing pictures" rather than the worst.So why is Catwoman not the worst movie of all times? The story is somehow acceptable, the characters are pretty flat, no real psychological depth to see. But on the other hand, some Batman movies for instance suffer from the same symptoms. So what's really disappointing here is Halle Berry playing the main character. But on the other hand, I guess its a good thing, she accepted the worst actress award here. She certainly improved, got an Oscar, and so she might have learned something here. Sharon Stone on the other hand didn't do much better here and it's a pretty bad piece of job, she did here.The story is boring, but I must say my biggest disappointment was to see a movie, which wasn't as bad as I expected it to be. Except for the effects, that were unacceptable all the time.

When I first looked at this movie (two days ago) I saw that it was piled with bad reviews from people. I wondered, what could make this movie so bad? So I did some research on what people thought was wrong with the movie. It came to this: the casting, the acting, the story, the special effects, etc. When I saw this, I thought to myself, now what would be so wrong about low-rated movies? I've always watched low-rated movies in which I thought were pretty good. So, I watched Catwoman. As I thought, it didn't seem as bad as people said it was. The casting and acting seemed fine to me. The story was pretty nice, though there are some parts that could be changed, like the whole thought of getting face cream that makes your skin as hard a marble. The special effects were decent enough to watch; they weren't that bad, but overall, my only complaint with this is "Why isn't there a Catwoman 2?" It's a very good movie that I would want to see a sequel to. I'd put this movie side by side to all of the other DC comic movies.

reviews.review_title: One of, if not the worst movie I had seen this year
reviews.content: It takes a special kind of movie to make me consider actually getting up and walking out on it. And I don't mean special in a good way.Now don't get me wrong, I am a very cheap person at heart (why deny it) and to me the money I spent getting in is usually a good enough reason to sit through a movie even if I hate it. Let me tell you, this movie tested that resolve...Let me say now and for the record, I do not hate Halle Berry. In fact I think she is an incredibly hot woman and I wouldn't kick her out of my bed if she decided to have a sleep over at my place. As an actress I do not have a problem with her, but I do have a problem with her choice of roles... maybe she needs a new agent (Halle I am available!)What everyone needs to realize is that Halle is not responsible for this movie sucking. It's the writers who need to be shot here (maybe director too /shrug). There is nothing to this movie... the entire thing feels to me like a very flashy commercial for some kind of Dominatrix shop in Hollywood. The plot holes are too numerous to even list here, and bringing them up might put me to sleep. Halle, even your beauty cannot save this film. It's a shame no one has learned from movies like Barbwire... just because you have a scantily clad sex goddess in the movie does not mean you can pay somebody $5 to write a script and expect people to actually enjoy your movie.To the writers/director/producers of this horrible movie: You should be ashamed of yourselves, please stop making movies and seek alternate forms of employment. Oh and screw you for making me waste my hard earned cash.P.S: Halle I meant what I said, I can surely do better as your agent then whoever is getting you into these terrible films... call me =)Matt

reviews.review_title: watch the movie, and you will find out a pleasant surprise
reviews.content: I read tons of negative reviews on catwoman. that's why i didn't see it till now, year 2005. to my surprise, the movie is a quite interesting piece with great music. it present things from different angles. showed a story of how a woman find the real self, and be confident. i never imaged that a basketball play could be portrayed in such flirtatious yet fun way till I saw this movie. And Halle gave us a cute, playful, confident, nice hearted, and sexy woman! I like this character much more than the one played by Michelle Pfeiffer years ago in batman. that one only left me a memory of a bad woman. but this one played by Halle Berry has a life, a character and something to remember.
Who greenlit this? This film took away the awesomeness of Catwoman and turned it into total trash.

reviews.review_title: Great Campy Film if nothing else
reviews.content: I really don't think half of the people who ripped it to shreds actually saw the film. The best thing about the film is the visual effects, I mean WOW! Great job. I've never seen anything like the effects here. Halle Berry does a good job at portraying the dual character of Patience Phillips (shy, coy, a bit of a push over) and Catwoman (strong, confident, focused). I don't see any actress who could've done better. The story line is less good. I liked the details about the "Catwomen" through history though.Sharon stone was campy but still great to watch.The action/fight sequences are really good too. Very nicely choreographed. The Catwoman costume was cheesy and I actually "purr-fered" her black leather motorcycle outfit.Cheesy/campy stuff you may enjoy on a slow afternoon when there is nothing better to watch, but NOT as bad as some would lead you to believe.

Halle Berry as CatWoman is lousy. She is obviously trying too hard to outdo Eartha Kitt's rendition of the feline superhero..., and she falls way short of the mark. Too bad the producers of this film didn't go with talent instead of looks. There were other actresses better suited to the role who would have contributed more to the character than striking a pose now and again with boobs. It's a real shame that such a legendary character wasn't given a better chance to "come alive" on the big screen. Perhaps the film should have used state-of-the-art computer-generated animations (ala Shrek) instead of actors. This movie could bring about the end of the comics-turned-blockbuster trend.

reviews.review_title: Words almost fail to describe how bad this movie is...
reviews.content: I can honestly say that I have never seen a movie this bad, and I've watched both of the "Mortal Kombat" movies. I managed to catch this for free on my friend's cable, so I don't feel as violated as I could if I had been paying to see the film. That doesn't mean I didn't feel plainly insulted by the garbage that this film tried to pass off as watchable. One can plainly see just by looking at this movie how horrible it is. The movie makers seem to have been trying to take the cheesiness of the final batman movie (which, might I add, made it bad) and mix it with a blatant feminist 'a-woman-is-as-good-as-a-man' mentality. The result of this cross-pollination is a blossom of something that goes far and beyond the level of asininity that any work of media should ever attempt.Halle Berry, who I don't like to begin with, acts about as well as a freshman high school student in their first school play (I wonder if she pictures the audience naked when she gets nervous?). Often times, what can help a movie recover from a poor lead are it's supporting actors. However, if by supporting actors, one means actors that help support the lead and tell the story well... then this movie had slim to no chance of recovery. Particularly rank were the performances of Sharon Stone (who always seems to be a detriment to whatever movie that was unfortunate enough to cast her) and Frances Conroy (who makes it feel like her character would do better as the insane Seer from J.K. Rowling's writing and not as the wiser woman she is supposed to be portraying). Benjamin Bratt seems to be the only one doing a halfway decent job of acting, and that is most likely due to the fact that he is once again cast as the same thing he seems to be in every work he does: a cop. With a cast that obviously doesn't have their heart in the work that they do, one can't help but wonder why they are even doing it. And that isn't even mentioning the poor writing and hideous (yes, HIDEOUS) costume design of Catwoman herself.It certainly makes me yearn for the days of yore, when Michelle Pfeiffer played a Catwoman who was more about the crime, or the 'hunt' if you will, than about the possible feminist aspects of being a strong and independent woman. The times when feline prowlers didn't have to prove themselves, and had the nine lives to back them up.

reviews.review_title: Really bad. Poor script n direction
reviews.content: Garbage movie. Director had no clue.Catwoman is better off at home, in da couch.Halle Berry deserved better, I am glad she is not doing the reboot.

reviews.review_title: A great concept gone awry because of directing
reviews.content: Catwoman is such a fantastic idea -- like Spiderman, Batman, Wonder Woman, etc.  And yet, the directing of the this film was so music video-influenced and A.D.D. that it did a disservice to Halle Berry and Ben Bratt.  Bratt and Berry's talents remain untapped for what they could have done. Additionally, the reduction of Berry's power to sexual attractiveness is a bummer -- and what are girls and boys to take from that?  Spiderman is sexy, but not looking like a centerfold.  Compared to Michelle Pfeiffer's Catwoman's walking the line of vulnerability, sexual power, and physical power, this presentation of the superhero/antihero feels like a disservice to the genre & to women and girls in general.  The base story pits woman against woman over beauty and sexual virility -- what's that about?  Is an aging gorgeous model really a sufficient nemesis?  And finally, is the overall "moral" that a strong independent woman cannot have a relationship? These are questions I fear the filmmakers never asked themselves, and, though this movie could have been great, it instead does a disservice both to the actors and to the audience.

reviews.review_title: Not top-100, but not bottom-100 either!
reviews.content: I went to this film expecting to see something VERY bad, poorly filmed, badly written and acted, and just plain cheesy.  Having read numerous reviews, online slams, and noticing Catwoman in the IMDB bottom 100, I fully expected to see the worst film of the year.It is not.  Certainly, it had some SERIOUS problems - too much use of low quality CGI and occasional dragging of the storyline/plot... but overall I was quite impressed with how much this movie really DID entertain and portray the comic-book world of Catwoman.  I've always loved movies based on comic books, and never judged them for how closely they follow the "true" comic book events... what matters to me is whether or not the movie really sweeps me away to another world where such superheros and villains are possible.  On this level, if no other, Catwoman does succeed... and quite well.Sure... the plot sucks (when was the last time you saw a superhero movie that revolved around evil beauty cream, for christsake!)... and some of the writing was completely idiotic (the cop boyfriend finding a diamond studded claw in the living room, then - being the awesome detective that he is... decides to match lip-prints because that just ISN'T enough evidence for him??? Come again????) - but the movie DOES have redeeming qualities.  I never found myself dozing off or wishing I was somewhere else during this movie... as I did more than once at Spiderman 2... and the movie doesn't spend overly long periods of time trying to convince us that the superhero is REALLY just another vulnerable, scared human being who has real feelings and faults (GAG....!!!).My verdict?  6 out of 10 - entertaining, convincing comic book world, deducted 4 points for lame story and over-use of really bad CGI.

Sure there are some dumb things happening in the movie and way too much CGI, but who cares - it is only an average summer flick to be watched on some rainy Friday evening.To summarize - it is not great but if you enjoy comic-based movies, go for it.

reviews.review_title: Not Purrrfect But Far From Catastrophic
reviews.content: In the modern age of 'girl power', the 3 S's - strong, sexy, and smart, were powerfully represented in Catwoman 2004. The original three Catwomen (Julie Newmar and Eartha Kitt (1966-68 TV series), and Lee Meriwether (1966 movie)) embodied these qualities in uniquely creative ways. Michelle Pfeiffer's Catwoman (1992 movie  Batman Returns) was adequate, yet one-dimensional  her Catwoman was 'campy' and lacked the degree of sensual sexuality portrayed so vividly by her predecessors. Catwoman 2004 was okay  Halle shouldn't be expecting an Oscar nomination, but the movie doesn't deserve the scurrilous scrutiny that it has thus far received. Halle's Catwoman is intentionally unique  a blending of the old with a pinch of the new. The way that some people are reacting, one would have thought that Halle's Catwoman suit had experienced a wardrobe malfunction. Its major shortcomings are twofold (POTENTIAL SPOILER):1. Catwoman 2004 was more soap opera than comic. An evil cosmetic empire doesn't quite fill the all time comic listing for villainy. The current trend of making action films more appealing to the larger female demographic by sacrificing the testosterone action (favored by adolescent males, ages 15 to 55) in lieu of the softer romantic elements only results in taking the 'edge' off. Catwoman, like Batman, is born from tragedy. Her story, therefore, should have been modeled more after Batman  darker and with a subtle hint of misfortune, even heartbreak.2. It did not feature a major comic villain. Since the movie was going for the toxic makeup why not use it as an opportunity to debut 'Clayface' with Lambert Wilson or as a female re-imagination with Sharon Stone. This one change would have tied together the cosmetic company and the toxic makeup in a typical comic storyline. Doing so would have potentially achieved the same results as Jack Nicholson's Joker. Stone's character never fully achieved a villain status. (SPOILER) When she orders Patience to be flushed, it is done off-camera, as is the murder of her husband. Comic villains need to earn their notoriety.There are three key areas that Catwoman 2004 needed to fulfill in order to successfully make the transition from comic to film  Story/Action/Characters:1a. STORY (Origin of the hero/villain)  Establishes the background of the main characters (romantic interests, friends/family/cohorts, etc), their motivations, how their powers/abilities are derived, and their inner journey of discovery (either good or bad). Heroes are fine, but everyone loves to hate a great bad guy/girl.1b. STORY (Translation)  (1) Translation of the essential story elements from the comic to a mixed audience (those who are avid fans and those who are 'un-read' newcomers), and (2) A measured degree of modernization since many of the mainstream comics have been around for almost 40+ years.2a. ACTION (Hero/Villain Confrontation)  The quintessential showdown is a mainstay of the comic genre.2b. ACTION (Cinematography/Computer Visualization)  Technology has evolved to the extent that film creators can now virtually produce anything visually with the aid of computers and digital technology. The challenge should not be how much computer generation (CG) one can pack into a scene for the sake of doing it (which unfortunately, is so often the case), but how best to compliment the story credibly and not in a cartoonish or fake manner.3. CHARACTERS (Cast selection)  How accurately a chosen actor comes to personify the essence of the character they are portraying; mannerisms/body language, chemistry with other actors, and screen presence.With all this being said I would give Catwoman the following scores: Story (6/10)  (1) Catwoman's origin was convincingly explained, (2) Patience Phillips had a life before Catwoman (albeit hectic and devoid of fun), (3) the romance between Patience and Tom Lone was sizzling (who wouldn't want to go one-on-one with Halle, even if you might get scratched?), (4) the story development was adequate, considering the fact that Catwoman as a comic book character has traditionally been supplementary, not primary, and (5) a standard villain should have been used, ideally Clayface.Action (5/10)  An effort was made to give Catwoman her own fighting style, but I am a little tired of movie characters who magically become kung fu masters. Even this aspect can't be explained away by a cat's breath (ancient Egyptian or otherwise) since I have never known of a kung fu kitty.The CG was a little overdone and lacking at times in visual realism.Characters (6/10)  Cast selection was superb: Halle Berry (Patience Phillips) embodies the 3 S's, on or off screen. Benjamin Bratt (Tom Lone) was a perfect romantic counter point to Halle drawing from his abundant TV/Movie cop experience (Law & Order / Miss Congeniality/Demolition Man). Sharon Stone (Laurel Hedare) is a veteran actress whose 3 S's have matured tastefully and were uncannily well suited for the role. Lambert Wilson (George Hedare) portrays a contemptible character (reminiscent of Matrix II & III) - a derriere silk wiping kinda guy. Alex Borstein (Sally) was outstanding in providing saucy comic relief (When does the 'Ms. Swan' movie debut?).Overall, it deserves a rating between 5 and 6. Catwoman 2004 wasn't perfect, but it was an enjoyable action film. It wasn't Spiderman, but it sure wasn't Howard the Duck either. If you have a phobia/dislike for cats or you have a pre-disposition for someone other than Halle to play Catwoman, then maybe this isn't the movie for you. But if you're just looking for an entertaining comic film, then give Catwoman a 1-out-of-9 chance.

Catwoman is not a "great" movie, but I think some folks have given off-kilter reviews of it. Firstly, its a pure entertainment movie: its not intended to be deep, nor did I expect it adhere to a particular version of the rather malleable history of the character. Its an interpretation of the Catwoman legend, not unlike all the different interpretations that have appeared in the comics over the years.I enjoyed Catwoman. I think Halle Berry brought the proper "cat like" attitude to the role. The character came across as sultry, playful, and very much capable of looking after herself...and the "pre-Catwoman" Patience was fragile without being ludicrously so. The character was truly likable, and not just because Ms. Berry is attractive. The special effects could have been better: there were times when the CG Catwoman lacked appropriate physics, but I can overlook that. There was a good "spark" between Catwoman and the Detective character, and I actually got to really dislike the evil makeup queen played by Sharon Stone.Frankly, I think the negative feedback for this movie was undeserved.

This film was so incredibly good, it showed a self-confident woman, the film was brilliant, the camera work was extremely good, I don't have to talk about the acting performance. A film for feminism, I don't understand why it's so badly rated and why it didn't win an Oscar.

I don't know much about Catwoman, but this one is different from some I've seen. I'm not going to research origins here, but this one is interesting, imbuing her with real powers. The others I've seen are women who choose to be Catwoman. Here she is turned into Catwoman and has real cat-like behavior (see the movie and try to give the graphics a break). I believe that no movie actually rates a 1 or a 10. Voting a movie up or down to change its rating is misleading, which is the worst thing you can have on rating list site. That being said, it is NOT a 1 and it is NOT a 10! Stop it y'all! The good points I've gone over. Now the bad news. Weak story, simplistic dialogue and uneven CGI ruin the great premise that I liked. It is a 4 or a 5. But, I would watch it again. Another reviewer suggested that it might become a cult classic because its so bad. I think so too. There is something about Halle Berry's movements as Catwoman, both live and CGI that truly seem inhuman, and border on hilarious.

Catwoman has become one of the most despised films of 2004. Critics and fans alike mauled and hissed at it, criticizing everything from Halle Berry's acting to Pitof's direction. It even got 7 Razzie nominations. However after viewing this film on DVD, I was pleasantly surprised. The film has numerous flaws but its not as bad as its made out to be.Halle Berry plays Patience Phillips, shy artist by day, bank-robbing Catwoman by night. There is a plot, but it quickly takes a backseat to shots of Halle Berry strutting around in a S&M suit. While its not her best performance, Berry convincingly balances the two personalities of her character. Its the supporting cast where the movie begins to fall apart. Sharon Stone is terrible in her role as the villain, she either spits out her lines or overacts the entire picture. The other characters are not developed enough to care.While one good actress can carry a decent movie, Pitof ruins the film with heavy editing and terrible use of CGI. The fight scenes are so choppy that they allow a man to stand in as Halle Berry's stunt double. Other scenes such as Catwoman on the motorcycle look like the camera was tossed in a laundry machine. And while Halle Berry looks gorgeous in the Catwoman costume, she is replaced half the time by a CGI catwoman that seems to be able to defy gravity at will. When the lead actress is the only thing a film has going for it, its best not to replace her with a digital puppet.Overall, this film is watchable if only to see Halle Berry strut in the Catwoman costume. Other than that, its a turkey. Save your money and buy something else.

And to PITOF, if that is your real name, Catwoman is a villain, not a sometimes villain, sometimes heroine, but a villain. Read the comics and watch reruns of the TV show Batman with Adam West. She is a villain. Besides Julie Newman was and always will be Catwoman. She was Catwoman more times than anyone. And no one, not even Eartha Kitt could touch the sensuality that oozed from Julie. Even today she's still sexy as ever.

There are only two redeeming features at all in this movie. One is that Halle Berry, as usual, is a gorgeous woman, so men at least will be mildly interested. The other is some passable CG animation, though compared to most blockbusters it's not worth anything.Here's the problem. Imagine that the director of a Brittney Spears music video is handed a budget for an action movie, and also gets to write the script. What do you think will happen? This movie will happen. The plot is absolutely pathetic, without any direction, context or motivations. It's like a 5 year old's imagination of what an action movie should be like.It didn't need to be like this. Halle Berry can act. The budget was there. But this is arguably the worst written and worst directed film I've ever seen. It's up there in the rarefied atmosphere of stinkers with "Ishtar". The only redeeming feature that makes it better than Ishtar is the fact that things happen and Halle Berry looks good. in Ishtar, Warren Beatty and Dustin Hoffman don't look that good, and much of the movie is just wandering around.But putting it in the same ballpark with Ishtar says a lot, doesn't it? There's an old Gary Larson "Far Side" cartoon captioned "Video store in hell," and every title is Ishtar. I think we can now revise that so half of the titles are Ishtar, and half are "Catwoman."

Please. Selena was a lot better than that. Other than that, it was alright. One of the more positive points is that this version actually told the story, background and all, of Catwoman. Berry was god and hot but don't bother watching this flick.If you're a fan of Berry's it may be worth it, but NOT if you really dug Catwoman in Batman. However blasé the special effects were the music was good and went along great.

This movie set new record for me the fastest film that makes me bore and decide to stop watching. Quite amazing, considering that I am big fan of Sharon Stone, and who doesn't like to watch Halle Berry (especially in this tight costume).Three reasons to avoid this movie : (a) The story is very straight and predictable.(b) The character is terrible. May be it want to copy Spiderman recipe, by showing the dark side and psychological conflict within the hero character. But what happened here is total failure.(c) Usually I am quite tolerant to movie. But this movie left me nothing to enjoy. When I heard this movie was first coming out i was very excited. but then i read and heard all the critics reviews and i allowed it to keep me out of the theater, i regret that, i did see it on DVD and the movie was not bad. i was not expecting sum deep dramatic story, just to be entertained. and i was. the acting was good, the special effects were really good. I mean we are talking about a woman who dies and becomes a human cat. how seriously can you take that. Hally looked absolutely beautiful. she looked incredible in very scene....that alone was worth it for me... i just think the reviews were much to harsh...if anyone has thought about seeing this movie and was turned of buy the critics please see the movie and make your own judgment, i think if you do you will be pleasantly surprised. thanks

My conclusion:Catwoman is a movie that is perfectly watchable but not without that stinging feeling of wasting your life. The highlight of this movie is the moment when you realize that they refrained from filming the standard sex scene and left it to the imagination.The movie appears to be intended mostly for female audiences, with a lot of cheesy romance clichés, the single female sidekick friend, and so on. However, this does not fit in with the obvious attempts to cover up for a weak story with colorful imagery of Halle Berry's body from all thinkable angles. This might be appreciated by the male audience, but all there is left for the women, I guess, is the "story".Also, vast parts of the movie looks (and sounds) like a r-n-b music video and I don't like it.A lot of the action reminds you of Spider-man 2. Quite overdone computer animation, and fighting scenes that try so hard to impress by being fast and innovative, that your brain sometimes can't keep up with what's going on.There is not much to comment about the story. It barely exists.The acting is adequate. Halle Berry isn't half as bad as you would expect from other people's comments, but she won't get an Oscar for this. Lambert Wilson does an exact copy of his performance as Merovingian (from those Matrix sequels I'm trying to forget all about).The movie overall feels very cheap. As of writing, the movie is #66 on the "Bottom 100" list, and it deserves to climb to, say, somewhere around 20-25.If you liked "Daredevil", you might like "Catwoman".--------------------------------- Detailed contents of the movie: Below is the list of what I considered to be crucial up and downs of this movie, in roughly the same order as they appeared in the movie (I wrote them down while watching the movie).Bad thing: R-n-b soundtrackCliché #1: Evil company that's going to cause the end of life as we know it (In this movie, it sells beauty products!)Bad thing: Crappy computer animated catsGood thing: Nice visuals. That is, I like the camera framing, movements, and general direction.Cliché #2: Fight scene that consists mostly of kicks. Choreographed to display as much of female leads legs as possible.Bad things: Overdone r-n-b soundtrackCliché #3: Female sidekick friend to female lead: "Oh my god, he's so hot! You have to date him!"Bad thing: Too much chick-flick-feeling (see the introduction of the male lead and see for yourself)Cliché #4: Scene in rave club, relying heavily on stroboscopes, slow motion and fast cuts to look cool.Cliché #5: Male and female lead playing a game with lots of giggling and close-ups of their smiles.Cliché #6: Child cries: "Mom!". Closeup on random woman in crowd that cries: "Frankie!". Later, they are shown happily reunited. (Otherwise not relevant to story)Cliché #7: Male lead: "I'll save the day!". Female lead ends up saving the day, impressing everyone.Good thing: Catwoman actually becomes crazy about fish and catnip and avoids water! Like, did Spiderman ever eat a fly?Good thing: Recurring themes, names, and objects used almost wisely in storytelling (like the phrases "midnight", and "it's over").Very good thing: Predictable sex scene omitted.Cliché #8: Police arrive faster than the time it takes to run out of the house.Good thing: Finally a joke I actually thought was fun. Except I'm not sure it was supposed to be that funny.Bad thing: Computer graphics that look like the worst 1% of Spider-man 2 stretched out to 1 hour.Bad thing: Product placement. Amongst other things, a video cell phone, that has far better picture quality than the real life product (which exists).Cliché #9: Villain's evil girlfriend turning out to be a good enough fighter to stand up to the female lead who has hitherto kicked everyones asses.Bad thing: Really lousy final fight sceneCliché #10: Evil company's logo conveniently placed so to accommodate appropriate landing spots for losers of fights enacted on the building's top floor or roof.Cliché #11: Male lead shot, unable to participate in hero activities, not wounded enough to need to lay down and cough blood.Bad thing: The writers just remembered they had a little subplot going on with the lead's best friend, and puts in a 10-second shot showing how that ended.Bad thing: Movie ends after villain is killed. Halle Berry delivers a voice over talking about something freedom bla bla and the movie is out.Good thing: No "bullet-time" scenes, or at least very few. It became cool in "The Matrix", it became silly in "Scary Movie", it was made tasteless in "Charlie's Angels 2", and I hope to God that future filmmakers will use this technique with taste and care.

reviews.review_title: Even the prettiest woman has imperfections...
reviews.content: And in Halle Berry's case, it's her acting. O.K, maybe I'm being a bit harsh. Let's just say that whatever talent that garnered her an Oscar was not present in this year's CAT-astrophe, "Catwoman". The movie is a contrived, career vehicle for Halle Berry that has no heart whatsoever and a very predictable plot line. Sharon Stone's "comeback" is nothing more than a badly written villain. Every aspect of this film made me cringe. And for the hardcore comic lovers out there, the only thing remotely catwomanish about this is the costume and the title. The makers of this film obviously did not give a crap about staying true to any aspect of the story. I guess they thought, "Hey, if the movie is chock full of CGI, they won't care! Look at Spiderman, that did great!" Only morons or those that are severely out of choices will enjoy this film. Personally, the only thing I enjoyed was the free air-conditioning and the exceptional popcorn I got to help me through this experience. For you self-respecting movie fans out there, a word of advice. DO NOT WATCH THIS MOVIE.

reviews.review_title: Great film, says a media student.
reviews.content: I must say that this film is brilliant! It's exciting to watch, has brilliant effects and even shows knowledge towards the themes of Ancient Egyptian mythology in terms of cats in religion.So, most people don't like this film. I whole-heartedly disagree! I think that this is a fantastic film that explores the origins of the Marvel comics character, Catwoman, that nothing has done before! Not only does it throw new light on the subject but does it in some style in my personal opinion!Now lets start...When I heard that there was a Catwoman film, my initial thoughts were "Oh god, another attempt by Marvel comics to make more money out of a crap character", but I'm pleased to say that I was wrong!There are a few possible plot-holes, but lets take one for example: Patients walks into the cosmetics factory for the first time. What most people don't notice is: Patients walks into the restricted area as she is desperately trying to keep her job. This door is open because the wife of the CEO of the company, Laurel Hedare, has snuck in to meet with one of the company's scientific advises about the toxic nature of the anti-ageing product.This film uses a lot of CGI sequences to great effect. The CGI that is used creates an effective feel of what Catwoman is really capable of.The most intriguing point of Catwoman are her cloudy motives. Catwoman has always been shown to be a shadowy character, never quite 'Good'. Her point in this film is revenge, and to protect the women of the planet. This is in-keeping with the Ancient-Egyptian ideologies of cat worship as were seen as protection symbols. (just research "Mafdet" or "Bast")The back-story revolves a 'Magical Cat', but the theme of Midnight the cat is in-keeping with the themes and ideologies of the ancient-Egyptians: cat's are protectors. Catwoman herself is definitely not a 'hero', I think that it's common knowledge that Catwoman has NEVER been a hero. In all mediums of the media Catwoman has been shown to do whatever suits her, regardless of if it's moral or not.Finally- Halle Berry's performance in this role brought really depth to the duality of Patient's character, showing off the almost bi-polar nature of the main character to a superb standard! 8/10. Worth a watch!!

reviews.review_title: a remarkable piece of film making
reviews.content: Having gotten the chance to see this film a whole month before it is out in Australia, I am very pleased to review it.This is a remarkable film for all involved. Comic purists might dislike the fact the characters origins have been changed but they have been changed for the better.This film truly represents what Catwoman is suppose to be, half woman, half cat. Halle Berry is simply astonishing as Patience/Catwoman, before she is Catwoman she shows us a remarkable and weak character and truly embodies the character, and when she becomes Catwoman WOW! she is amazing!.Sharon Stone is also superb but the real greatness is the script, the script, in my opinion is Oscar worthy, it is perhaps the most complex and beautiful script since American Beauty.All in all Catwoman is a masterpiece and by far the best superhero film ever made. 10/10

In Catwoman, Halle Berry plays Patience Prince, a shy, unassuming graphic artist at a cosmetics company. Prince lack the backbone to stand up to others, and generally stays out of everyone's way until she discovers that a new product has potentially lethal side effects that are being hidden from the public. Yep, something is rotten in Denmark.Prince is then found out by the bad guys and left to die, but she not only recovers but also absorbs some mystical cat powers. Now armed with catlike agility and dexterity, she clads herself in a cat-eared cap and CGI whip and goes out to get revenge in her new identity as a cat-burglar anti-hero. Conflicts ensue, she meets romantic interest Bratt, and dukes it out with Sharon Stone.This movie is thoroughly and unapologetically dumb. With silly dialog, cardboard acting and some pretty mediocre action sequences, Catwoman is much more corn than comic book. Halle Berry is a talented actress, but in Catwoman she acts likes she's on auto-pilot, and only drags the whole thing down further. Sure, Catwoman was never supposed to be a Casablanca, but even a popcorn movie needs intelligence and fun. Catwoman is just a sprawling mess. If extreme-campiness is up your alley it may be worth a look, but otherwise don't waste the ten dollar box office fee on this turkey.

Sure, but I didn't pay for the rental.Catwoman is about a girl who dies, but a few cats bring her back to life and she becomes a... bad/good girl? That's the thing about the movie that didn't work for me. Catwoman would beat the crap out of someone and steal jewelry, then she returns the jewelry with a sorry bag and feels bad for the guy that she killed. They should've written Catwoman as a villain, like we all learned to love her as in Batman. I love cats, but they made cats out of CGI and it looked sorta fake. Lots of the movie was CGI, but that's okay. But they overused it, in my opinion.If you've got an hour and thirty-eight minutes to waste, and a few dollars, rent the movie? But don't buy it. It's not as bad as many people say it is, however.

Catwoman is the sexiest, strongest and most intense female superhero ever. Adored by many, reaching extreme heights in popularity in the Batman universe such as in comics, t.v. shows and movies. Following the character's strong fan-praise in Tim Burton's 1992 hit Batman Returns, a spin-off feature with Catwoman in the lead had been in works for years, with both Tim Burton and actress Michelle Pfeiffer coming in and out of the project. With scripts being rewritten and retooled, it finally reached the perfection point in which eagerly anticipated fans are given a Catwoman that has NOTHING to do with Batman and is a completely different character than fans know and love from the comics.The film centres on Patience Philips (played by Halle Berry), a shy and insecure graphic designer working for a big cosmetics company, who while stumbling upon illegal activity from her bosses, is killed soon after, until being brought back to life by a mystical cat named Midnight giving her cat-like abilities. Discovering who and what she is now, Patience decides to use her new-found powers to find out who killed her and why.The film tries to be a mixture between a chick flick and a revenge action movie, it practically doesn't work, it's like trying to combine Sex And The City with The Crow. Another one of the film's disadvantages is the portrayal of the character herself, in the comics: Selina Kyle is a cat burglar who has conflicting motives between trying to do good and wanting to do whatever she wants and is Batman's on-and-off-again girlfriend. In this film: Patience has self-esteem issues and is wanting to break free from her job to become a free-lance artist, her character development is resolved only in the use of multiple personality disorder. VERDICT - Halle Berry's performance is somewhat okay but nowhere near good. The rest of the acting is a bit hokey. The editing is practically out of control, the cinematography is fine. The storyline is weak and above all else, the film is enjoyable just to look at for a short period of time not to invest in. Rating - 2/10

reviews.review_title: Warner Brothers execs are both genius and moronic
reviews.content: For not using the source material (Catwoman from the Batman universe), though Bob Kane is acknowledged for creating the character (old Bob is rolling over in his grave s I write this), Warner Brothers is smart. Now if they choose to introduce Catwoman in the newly revamped Batman franchise they can without this wretched piece of film coming back to bite them in the bum.Forgive me, I need to vent this and get it out somewhere since I have been expressly forbidden to write a review on my own website (cross promotional industry deal with a couple partners... I can't believe we're supporting this train wreck of a film!) The movie started off with some interesting tidbits about ancient Egyptian beliefs about cats and the goddess Bast, that was the best part of the movie and it was inserted under the opening credits. Not caring much for Halle Berry to begin with, the first quarter of this movie is her bumbling about, over acting and trying differentiate the character from her future Catwoman persona. It's definitely like watching a car accident first hand... in slow motion.Beyond the horrible acting by everyone there's the bad direction. Pitof is allegedly a decent director but in this movie his choppy and stylized direction is like watching an 80's music video while wired on high doses of caffeine. There is very little redeeming quality in this movie save for a few witty lines and decent scenes. Definitely not worth the admission price (thank all that is holy that I got in for free) and I'm not even sure I'd recommend it for a rental. Nope. I think not. Wait for it to show up on basic cable in a couple years if you're awake late at night and feel like wasting 2 hours of your life.

reviews.review_title: 1 hour 39 minutes of my life that I will never get back...
reviews.content: I was set to write a long, scathing review of this absolute trash of a movie, exposing its endless list of flaws and going into excruciating detail about why this is easily one of the worst movies I have seen in the last DECADE. But, to be honest, I really don't think it's worth my time. What I will say unequivocally is this: The script is 6th grade level at best. The story-line is amateur-hour. The special effects, action scenes, and fight choreography are a joke...totally boring, fake, and generic. The final nail in the coffin? The acting is embarrassing. I've never been a huge fan of Halle Barry, but this movie proves to me that she is far, far over-rated. She is a decent, even above average actress given the right vehicle for her talents...but her abilities are not in an elite class where she is able to make an otherwise boring or bad movie watchable. Some actors have that kind of screen presence where they can make trash seem somewhat interesting. She does not. The director should never get another job in Hollywood. This movie came off like some kind of masturbatory fantasy, like a 1.5 hr long music video gone wrong. Spend your time doing something, anything else. Mow the lawn with scissors. Turn the heat up and re-do the drywall in your house. Shove bamboo under your finger-nails. Just don't see this movie. Don't give the misguided producers and talentless hack of a director some kind of false reward for this garbage. We want comic book adaptations that are worthy of their franchise and our hard-earned dollars. This steaming pile of dung is neither. Avoid at all costs.

reviews.review_title: Chick Flick Disguised as Seductive Superhero Story
reviews.content: This review comes hot off the tail (already going for puns) of viewing this film, which was done in a nearly empty matinée. First off, I like movies, almost any sort of movie, so I'm able to come up with an optimistic view most of the time. Just a note on how these next paragraphs may be shaded.Any who have seen the trailers know that this film is being toted as a sexy, action-packed, superheroine film. Most will expect special effects, elegant fight-scenes and all the cheesy one-liners typically found in comic-book based audio/video entertainment. Even the IMDb totes this as Action, Adventure and Crime.This movie is mostly semi-romantic, psychological drama. Catwoman takes a back seat to Patience Phillips.Most of Catwoman's interactive moments seem forced, it's not that the felinity doesn't seem fit Halle, Catwoman's dialogue has always been a hard sell, wherever it has appeared. Halle Berry gives more life to the role of Patience, the interaction between her and Sally (Alex Borstein in a Romantic Comedy) more real than the drama between Catwoman and Hedare. All the timidity and fear of Patience and the confident arrogance of Catwoman is well portrayed, the meowing is a just little trying.Ben Bratt fits Tom Lone so well, you'd think he'd been playing him on television for years, I half-expected to see Jerry Orbach in a scene or two. His chemistry with Berry is wonderful, making it hard to believe Detective Lone couldn't see right through the leather mask.For raw hatred, behind an unmoving porcelain mask, Sharon Stone shows why she is a veteran of this industry. She puts more emotion into the eyes of Laurel Hedare than many villains have in their whole before-I-kill-you-Mr-Bond tirade.Overall I have given this a seven, with an important stipulation. This is not the movie they told you it was. If you've seen the trailers, you're probably going to be disappointed

I almost pulled some very important facial muscles because of all the eye-rolling I did during this film. While it is full of eye candy, which comes mainly in the form of Halle Berry and Benjamin Bratt in various stages of undress, it's not enough to sweeten the plot. And, the SFX of catwoman leaping through the city skyline suffers in comparison to the same type of sequence in "Spiderman 2." Sharon Stone looks fantastic, too, and can still vamp with the best of them. But all the stars are wasted in this disappointment. Although, Ms. Berry sure knows how to work that dominatrikitty outfit. In a summer full of intelligent action movies like "S2," and "Bourne Supremacy," this one is dull, listless, and has plot holes you could drive a semi through. I was looking forward to a decent "tough chick" movie this summer, but this ain't it! "Catwoman" should be dumped into the kitty litter.

reviews.review_title: Err... am I missing something here???
reviews.content: ... OK, let me get straight, am I suppose to hate this film? Because from my point of view, I actually thought it was not that bad! And I was a bit tad shocked when I looked up this movie on IMDb and seen the rating! 3.2?? Seriously, why the hate?? If you want to watch and enjoy action films like this, I suggest people don't bring their critic minds with them, otherwise this ain't the movie for you.This movie is essentially all about entertainment. It doesn't necessarily want to be the best summer blockbuster ever, it's just there for fun! And if you expect this film to have a witty plot and out of this world action, I suggest you switch over and watch something like Troy because Catwoman is just popcorn fluff for people who want to forget themselves for 1 and a half hours and have a good time.OK I fairly well admit this film has its flaws. Things like some of the acting. I admit I was a little disappointed with Halle Berry's "sasisfactory performance" and it was clear that she could have outdone herself a bit further. And I noticed from reading the reviews, people have criticised the plot, but its just there for you do enjoy!! Catwoman is not wanting to go for the BAFTA for the best screenplay in the world!Overall, stop being so cynical ladies and gentlemen! Catwoman is entertaining fluff! It is made to entertain!! So on a late Saturday night, rent this film, get all the refreshments and everyone round, turn out the lights, and just enjoy yourself for 1 and half hours and even throw the popcorn at the screen if you wish! It's not brain surgery!8/10 - IT WAS GOOD!

reviews.review_title: How dare you insult michelle pfeiffer
reviews.content: This movie was a complete waste of time,after all these years it's still a bad movie with a laughable plot.

Oh, please. I will start by saying that I am far from an aficionado when it comes to movies...but this was just insulting.How much can you borrow from other movies (rooftop scene [Spidey 1]; fighting sequences and bullet time [Matrix]) and how many clichés can you use? They portrayed Patience like she had a severe case of MPD throughout most of the movie (after the "transformation" into Catwoman) and really did not stay true the character Catwoman was supposed to be (see: Michelle Pfeiffer in Tim Burton's EXCELLENT Batman Returns) and basically the only reference they made to that character at all is the way they played up in the final scene that she only had one life of 9 left)They really tried to play up that Catwoman was an entirely new character (and new person that became her), and it honestly did not work. The better route might have been to recast Michelle and do a prequel leading up to the events in Batman Returns (or spin-off of that)Ever go to Wal-Mart and look in the $5 DVD bin? while watching Catwoman I got the feeling that this waste of film will be there sooner than later.Rating: .5 */***** (For Halle's hotness through the first half an hour of movie, and the great Klaus Badelt soundtrack.)
