It is light on content, light on clothing for Halle, light on well light...It is however somewhat entertaining as a simple fantasy flick. It's not a 1 or a 2, its not a 9 or a 10. It's one of those middle of the road movies, that is probably better seen on DVD or TV later. It isn't a big screen treat, but it is somewhat fun.

From the first 5 minutes of this film, during which I noticed that the camera never sits still (I challenge you to find a classic still camera shot in the movie), I knew that this was a poorly made and completely run of the mill film. There are some camera angles utilized which would have been more interesting 5 years ago before The Matrix started the trend which countless other films have now copied. The acting is what can be expected by a laughable Academy Award winner, and the writing seems like it was generated by a computer which was fed every Schwarzenegger 1 liner and simply rewrote them. What really makes this movie lame is the expectation that the public (American especially) will be impressed by a CGI superhero leaping about. We _were_ impressed by this when it was done well and they called the movie Spider-Man. The CG effects are not done well, they look overly cartoony and are used far too much; for example whenever there is a fly-by shot of the city a model would have looked a lot better. All in all, there is nothing about this movie worth watching if you are a film fan.. unless of course you are a red-blooded American male, then at least there is Halle Berry ;)

reviews.review_title: Are we sure Uwe Boll didn't direct?
reviews.content: I will give the reasons for you to run from Catwoman in list form to keep it simple and direct.1) Catwoman isn't anything without Batman to antagonize the featurette on the faces of Catwoman knows this but the geniuses behind the movie missed it. 2) What was the last good cosmetic themed movie you've seen? 3) It's exactly like Spiderman if everybody involved especially the CG artists had massive brain damage. 4) Backstory is dumb and thankfully she had someone tell her she was Catwoman I don't want to think how long the movie would have been if she had to figure it out herself. 5) At least 1/2 the movie is dedicated to her romantic interest which she quickly disposes of in a "dear john" letter in 15 seconds at the end. 6) Most importantly and this seems to be a common thread in all failed superhero movies WHY MAKE A SUPERHERO MOVIE WITHOUT A SUPER VILLAIN? Sharon Stone's hard as marble makeup skin isn't quite the Green Goblin or Dr. Octopus is it. One positive, thankfully because this movie met with universal despise the potential cliffhanger ending will remain without sequel.

reviews.review_title: Halle"I'm too sexy for my leather"Berry-- Spoiler
reviews.content: If Halle Berry in a leather suit is right up your "alley" then this is the show for you. I didn't think that the story was bad. It just wasn't good. Catwoman was a bad guy! She didn't rob a jewelry store one minute then put the goods in a bag apologizing the next. No, she wanted she took, no apologies needed. I would have liked it better if there had been even one mention of Batman/Bruce Wayne, her arch nemesis/true love, but no; she falls for some cop that is the same goody goody that she was pre-death. Granted, it does have some really great CGI effects when they have her running and jumping the way a cat would, but not cool enough to spend money to see. So to summarize what I felt about this film...It's Halle"I'm too sexy for my leather"Berry, and Benjamin"should have stayed on Law and order"Bratt catting around for 2 hours(or however long it took that awful film to end)mee-yuck!

This movie is clear proof that Hollywood has given up and let themselves become way too commercial. All this movie is about is a hot chic in a cat suit. Any true fan of comic books made into movies will be thoroughly disgusted. I'm not a comic book reader, myself. But I am a fan of integrity. They have gone mad and give us public no credit for intelligence. Another example...look who is going to be the next Batman. A talented actor, yes...the right person to play a young Bruce Wayne? Are you kidding me? I was excited about Catwoman coming out and was anxious to go and see it. It is a great movie. Great story, great acting, great directing. I give it props as a movie. But, Catwoman it is not! It should not have taken the Gotham city title. It should have been titled, The Feline Avenger, or something not related at all to the beautiful, dark and mysterious story lines they worked so hard to create at DC Comics.

Note: I checked off the "spoiler thing" but just to let you know that this movie is pre-spoiled. Just like sour milk that has spilled down the back of the fridge and starts to reek really bad after a few days, this movie has the same results, but only takes 104 minutes to accomplish it!Is this character supposed to be Selina Kyle from Batman? Since she has a different name, origin, setting, and surrounding characters, I have to make the logical assumption and say "no". So why then try to rip off the "Catwoman" name and do a wretched job at it? They should have named the film "Midnight Train to Feline Fine"...or "Halle Sissorhands"...And COME ON when I see Alex Borstein on television I EXPECT her to do the Gap-troll skit from Mad-TV...No...I demand it! I can only assume they had to get Borstein because Rosie O'Donnell was busy making a DIFFERENT piece of crap.Hated the characters (and this is a strong hate)...I liked Halle's "Costume" (hehe) but long hair looks better on her...the romantic subplot was needed I guess to fill in the remaining 76 minutes where nothing was happening...they really should have thought about expanding the "Deleted Scenes" section of the DVD.Here are a few spoilers: 1 ...Picture a death scene, if you will...a cat enters stage left and gives CPR to the dying heroine...she is reborn...with supernatural cat powers (for some reason). 2 ...Bad Girl: "Game Over" Good Girl: "Its Overtime" 3 ...burglar surfing 4 ...Heroine grabs the bad guys tongue and says (get this) "Cat got your tongue?"...that's too funny...I never saw that coming 5 ...OK...now here is the biggest spoiler of all...its all about cosmetics. Thats it, thats the whole plot...now you can thank me for saving you 104 boob-less minutesYou know where Homer Simpson is watching Paint Your Wagons (Clint Eastwood/Lee Marvin) and he ejects the tape directly into the garbage can...thats what modern DVD players should come with...I could have used it for this movie...

I never believed in review so I had an idea why not watch this movie? And why is the rating is so poor?
I wish I never had asked that to myself.
I was curious to see how bad this film can be and oh boy, they were right.
I'm a huge fan of catwoman so the representation of her character made my fan heart broke into pieces. I was expecting to see the cheeky and clever woman but at first when I saw her I was surprised. Cause in her origon story she is a prostitute and a theif and she does not have any super powers.
I thought I will see an alright movie about my favourite anti-hero but I was wrong.
Still I'm giving it 3 stars because hey she is still my favourite character ever

reviews.review_title: Catwoman; the movie that should not have been made
reviews.content: My expectations were low before watching this movie. Not because i didn't think the concept is great, but i've heard comments on the film. some say it sucks, others say it rule. but i tried keeping an open mind. in the beginning of the movie, we meet a nervous chick, afraid to stand up for herself. which is OK. then she dies and becomes Catwoman. from there on it's all downhill. the movement, the OBVIOUS low budget animation, the story, the acting.. i could just go on and on, but i want to highlight a few things. 1. the nervousness still alive in Catwoman. why is it there? 2. the fact that she falls in love with a cop who just happens to be the one who is investigating the "Catwoman case". 3. the fact that i always could tell what the next move was. 4. the super-villain get her powers from facial cream. yeah, that's right. i could just have written that line, and everyone should know that this movie is a big no no. the facial creme which made her skin hard like marble.. i mean come on! that's a dead give-away. 5.they even had to animate the cat in several scenes! how hard can it be to get a cat to smell her face? 6. i'm a reasonable guy. i respect women, colored people, not-so-colored people, men, homosexuals.. however; this is a superhero movie, but why do i get the feeling it tried harder to be some sort of "black girl-power" flick? the soundtrack is straight up r'n'b with female singers. not that i have a problem with that kinda music, i enjoy it as much as the next guy or girl, but it's way over the edge.i could have written more, but the more i write, the more depressed i get. do yourselves a favor, and stay away from this.. ah, i don't know what to call it.

reviews.review_title: Good movie apparently marred by terrible first half
reviews.content: I saw this movie and can't believe it's the piece of garbage that everyone else saw. Then again, I only started watching it 40 minutes into the movie. That, I think, is the reason behind my enjoyment of the film and everyone else's bad reaction: something in the first 40 minutes was really terrible.The hour of the film I saw was light, entertaining fluff concerning a "superheroine" who had mysteriously gained powers after being murdered as part of a company cover-up. The action was OK, the romance between the detective and her was OK, and the setting was pretty nice.So what went so dreadfully wrong in the first 40 minutes which caused movie goers everywhere to have a yuck reaction? My hunch is that there was too much: A) Mention of her first name. Patience... what kind of name is that? It seems like a name one would find in a roleplaying game, not in a phone book. I only heard it twice in the last hour and that still made me cringe.B) Catwoman doing cat things. Batman never went around eating insects, cleaning his chest hair, and doing other bat-related biological functions. I've heard from a great many people that one of the opening scenes of the movie has Halle Berry doing stupid things like drinking milk and playing with a ball of yarn. That would kill pretty much any movie if what they say is true.So my suggestion: go ahead and watch the film, but fast-forward 40 minutes or so. Then you'll get your money's worth.

reviews.review_title: Might be the worst film I've ever seen
reviews.content: And I've only actually seen the basketball scene on twitter and that'll all the information I need to confidently give this a 1/10. I felt emotions I've never felt before in 90 seconds.

I wasn't expecting very much from this film, but our son decided he really wanted to watch it and since Halle's hot, I didn't mind too much!As others have said, the plot was very simple and characters were pretty simplistic, although I think some people were forgetting that they weren't supposed to be real people, it's a comic book license after all! I've certainly seen many much worse films with comic book licenses, and the plot while thin, wasn't cheesy like virtually any of the usual summer Hollywood blockbusters from Emmerich and the like.The CGI wasn't nearly as bad as some people have said e.g. "The worst CGI I've ever seen" - oh come on! It was very obvious when they were using CGI and that was really my main complaint, but it was fairly well scripted with some interesting camera angles, was some times quite unique, and occasionally looked great (but not real).There were also some very nice visual moments in the film that I really didn't expect from this kind of film. If you didn't see them, you were either too involved in slagging off the plot, or whining about how it wasn't the same as Batman's Catwoman, or just won't sit back and appreciate the good points that films can have. Suffice to say that the director Pitof was involved in the visual effects of Messenger, Alien Resurrection (again a dubious film, but it looked good) and The City of Lost Children, and that the Cinematographer usually works on Luc Besson's films.So all in all, it was never going to be the best film in the world and I doubt too many of the moaners ever thought it would be when they entered the cinema. It was lame in places sure, but it was worth the money for entertainment and looked great in some places if you actually looked. Halle also looked great, and there were genuinely sexy moments in the film. Even my son (who can be a harsh film critic) sat still for the whole film (he hasn't for the Harry Potter films) and he gave it 20 out 10 which is a few points more than he gave Harry Potter :-)

I just saw (most of) Catwoman for the first time tonight, May 2013, despite its horrible 3.2 IMDb rating. There was plenty to criticize in this movie: a dubious plot, way too many direct cat clichés, under-par script, and CGI that should have been much more realistic.But as a pet lover and particularly a cat lover who is also a fan of the Narnia Chronicles, the idea of a feline breathing second life into a human has a mystical and spiritual quality to me, which piqued my interest. Good winning over Evil and the choice that Catwoman made regarding Bratt's character at the end left me satisfied.I thought Berry, Pratt, and Stone did a decent job, and of course I enjoyed seeing Berry in the Catwoman outfits. No Oscar material here in any way, but all told this movie for me deserves a better IMDb score.

Don't give me all that mularkey about an empowered woman. I felt more like I was watching a music video at times. There is this instinctive feeling inside me that lets me know if the movie I just watched was a good one. I left every single Marvel movie with that feeling... yes, even Daredevil and the Punisher. I left Catwoman thinking, "Wow... what the hell did I just waste $15 on?" If I had to score it in a DC vs. Marvel way... DC is getting is ass kicked handily. Pretty bad when Daredevil or the Punisher will win some sort of Academy Award before I will even consider THINKING about Catwoman again after this debacle. Super thumbs down. Go see the Bourne Supremacy instead.

Good or Bad??? Doesn't matter. This movie has gotten people to talk about if endlessly. People are renting the DVD and want to see what all the fuss is about. At some point long the line the movie will make nearly all it's production budget back, it may take a few years but it will recover financially. $85 million world at the box office, DVD sales and of course cable and broadcast TV sales.The studio learn a good lesson here, if you're going to change a comic book character entirely at least do some advance marketing of the new character in the form of a new comic book. And develop the characters in the movie to the degree that they are interesting. The public wants to see 'eye candy' with good sotryline!!!

Great disappointment after movies hype. Too much "cat walking". Halle although interesting, overacted "the cat". Stone too stiff (good name choice). Plot lines obvious at each turn. Even with it's created atmosphere, it's dark mystery isn't evident. As science fiction goes, this one doesn't come close to making you believe if even for a moment. Characters are made more from verbal descriptions, not acted portrayals. Far too choppy for such a short film. No immersion into the world of the film. Adult themes and overtones far outweigh it's artsy comic book origin. Why not have made it completely animated guys? You could have saved some money. Don't waste yours going to the theatres for this one. Rent it as a last choice.

reviews.review_title: First pretty boy Schumacher, and now this !
reviews.content: As a true devoted die hard Batman fan, I have to say that watching this movie was the most horrible experience of my life. What was Pitof thinking? the movie was so trashy that it looked like it was shot in a junkyard. Producer Denise Di Novi was in on this god forsaken pile of trash, and she was in on Batman Returns, which was very successful. I thought she would make Catwoman successful. What would really make Catwoman successful would be Michelle Pfieffer, Michael Keaton, Tim Burton, and of Danny Elfman. Pitof did not know what he was doing. Has this guy ever read a Batman or Catwoman comic book? Catwoman has always been about Batman, Not Benjamin Pratt. Batman and Catwoman are the real couple, like Superman and Lois Lane. Catwoman's real name IS Selena Kyle, NOT Patience Phillips. Catwoman lives in Gotham City, NOT Chicago, or New York, or even Canada! Catwoman is supposed to wear a sexy tight vinyl jumpsuit, not torn baggy leather pants, a leather bra, and open toed heels. That would be very uncomfortable to run and jump with without boots.I remember going out to see Catwoman with my girlfriend at the time. We did hear a lot of backlash before the movie was released. We went in to show support for DC Comics, especially since we both loved Batman and Catwoman. We hoped Catwoman would beat Spider-man 2 at the box office. But when the lights went on after Catwoamn, people got up and had a bad reaction like if they got mugged or punched in the stomach. I turned to my girlfriend and she did not say a word. But when I saw people coming out of Spider-man 2, I just wanted to scream and beat Spidey fans to death. If I wanted to be insulted, I would rather watch Schumacher's bright gay vision of Batman than to watch Catwoman ever again.

I had really high hopes for this movie especially because Hallie Berry is in it. However, not even her charm and charisma could save this movie from going down quicker than the Titanic. My biggest question: Is Ed Wood secretly alive and directed this movie? This is without a doubt the most miserable waste of talent, effects, not to mention $100 million dollars, which by the way the $100 million would go a long way in therapy bills for the poor wretched souls that either willingly sat through or were forced to go. It is my humble advice to avoid this movie as if it were Ebola Zaire. For those that think I'm being sarcastic and am to tough on this movie, go in and watch it and hopefully you'll have a greater understanding of what I'm attempting to convey.

reviews.review_title: Oh, come one, it's not all that bad
reviews.content: Catwoman is fun and mindless (in a good way). There are many worse movies---Legally BLonde II pops to mind immediately. The sound quality is 3-dimensional and the music is effective. There a many amusing moments, both verbal and visual. It's been panned as being thin in the plot, predictable and morally ambiguous. But why pick on Catwoman? Half the movies out of Hollywood can be described that way.If you want to see the incomparably beautiful Halle Barry come to life as a justice-seeking feline seductress who has to kick the evil butt of equally beautiful Sharon Stone, then this is a fun movie to watch.If you like the premise and the actors but have stayed away because of the critics, go with your instincts, ignore the critics and be entertained for 90 minutes.

I'm sorry but I did enjoy this movie. I thought it was fun and it gave me that same sense of intoxicating weird power that superhero movies tend to do. But that's because I was not looking at it like a film critic. I did not see this movie expecting an Oscar quality script, or brilliant special effects, or even tremendous acting. Just like when everyone else I knew was complaining about how bad the second PotC movie was, I said "Did you really go to see a movie called "Pirates of the Caribbean 2: Dead Man's Chest"? Expecting high quality?" Really, people. It's just a fun, silly movie. This happens all the time. People go to see a movie which clearly should not be taken seriously and then whine about how bad it was. It's just a fun, silly action movie. It's not inspiring, ingenious drama or clever witty satire.

reviews.review_title: Worse than Spinal Tap's "Shark Sandwich" Album
reviews.content: The two-word critique of Shark Sandwich is all I can think of when I remember this movie. It wasn't the horrible acting, graphics, plot, directing or camera-work that made this movie so bad. It is the morbid curiosity/wonder one feels while watching it, thinking that perhaps the movie will redeem itself in at least one scene, and that you can't stop watching it until that moment comes. Even the closing credits are horrid in this movie. I have seen movies that are intentionally bad, I have seen movies that try to be good, but wind up disappointing, but I don't think that the people who did this film even tried one bit to make something of it - and they wound up wasting precious minutes of my life that can never be recovered. Even watching Halle Berry saunter around in tight leather could not redeem this atrocity.

reviews.review_title: It takes a lot of effort to make a movie this bad
reviews.content: I recently saw this for the first time on HBO, and I must say that I lack to vocabulary to adequately describe just how bad this movie is. Bad acting, bad script, bad special effects, bad casting, and bad music. Halle Berry's appearance is this film's one redeeming quality, as she is as attractive here as she is in anything else she's ever done. Unfortunately, as soon as she starts to recite this film's ridiculous dialogue, her good looks are negated by everything else that is wrong with this movie. Although I think of Berry as one of the elite actresses of her generation, not even she can help but hack her way through the ludicrous dialogue she's forced to use. Of all recent films I've seen lately, this one is superior to "You Got Served" (the worst movie possibly of all time), but that's about it. Don't waste your time.

reviews.review_title: Why did they bother with this?
reviews.content: I read comics occasionally, so am fairly familiar with how the DC character Catwoman has been portrayed in the comics, and I can't for the life of me understand why they bothered connecting this movie with the comic character at all? I believe that had this movie avoided any connection with the comics it may have been a tad more successful, or at least appeared less of a failure. Why keep the Catwoman name if you aren't going to use any of the character's established history. At least then you wouldn't have had comics fans crying foul...There appeared to be a few good nuggets in this film, but the bad choices, in my opinion, far outweighed the interesting ones. That costume, I mean, come on! If I was leaping around rooftops and doing all that gymnastic stuff I think I would prefer to have some more protection around my back and belly, and that stupid head mask made me wonder if she was hiding some kind of brain swelling in there.Around the time the first photos of Halle in the skimpy costume came out, I recall reading it described as a costume fit for the porn version of Catwoman, very apt as far as I'm concerned.And the bad kept coming, all those cheesy one-liners that would have been more at home in the sixties show than coming out of Halle's mouth, the plot was wafer thin and predictable, the fight scenes, which in a superhero movie should be one of the high points, were cut so fast that it was hard to tell what was happening often, or else the wire work and CGI were too obvious.I rented this movie out of curiosity, to see if it really was that bad, and, well, it was... However some of the extra features on the DVD are interesting, especially the feature which has interviews with almost all of the people ever to portray Catwoman, and also many of the writers from the comics, all presented by Eartha Kitt, camping-it-up in a good way, unlike this lacklustre film.

Embarrassing. Cliché after cliché... why bother with the writing credits, all these people did was cut-and-paste from every crappy screenplay they could find. The plot was easily bested by any episode of Magnum PI and I am certain that the Ferris Wheel scene came from a CHiPs episode. Seriously, I encourage any of the writing team (FIVE of them!!!) to contact me if they find themselves involved in another movie project (highly unlikely)... I will write your next screenplay for you to save you from further embarrassment. I will do this for free. It will be my gift to the world. My qualifications: NONE, but I couldn't possibly screw anything up as badly as you people did with Catwoman. I won't even bother with any commentary on the directing... other than to note that Pitof hasn't worked since and, barring a perfect storm of stupidity, it is doubtful that he will ever direct again.

This contains *Spoilers*I saw the movie on opening day, and I was originally one of those people who said, "This movie is going to suck so badly." I walked out with a smile on my face, because I was wrong. When or if you go see this don't expect an Academy Award winning movie for Best Movie of the Year, just go see it to be entertained, what movies are made for.The movie starts out with Halle Berry as Patience Phillips, a somewhat clumsy girl who works in the Art Department for a cosmetics company. One day she is scolded by her boss, George Hedare, for messing up a art drawing she did for an ad. Sharon Stone plays George's wife, Laurel Hedare, who is a former model who is placed as top model for a younger model, who George pays more attention to. Laurel tells George to calm down and let her re-do the ad, which he gives Patience a dead-line for tomorrow at midnight. Patience, however, has an encounter with a mysterious cat named Midnight. Patience has no one to deliver the ad to George or Laurel, so she decides to go to the Hedare Factory and give it to an employee, and she walks into a screening of the side-effects of a new beauty cream called, "Beux-Line", that know one knew about, and after a certain number of years, your face will completely degenerate. Patience makes a run for it, before being chased by guards and eventually is flooded out in some waste pipes and is killed upon impact of the water. Midnight performs a ceremony where she turns Patience Phillips into Catwoman, a woman who basically has the senses and movements of the cat.  From that point on, Halle plays a sexy, bad-girl character while working with the average-looking, clumsy/always-apologizing character at the same-time. Halle Berry does a good job balancing her characters out.Now for the negatives..1) The constant camera change angles can bug the viewer, as I was bugged about how none of the fight scenes are solid, but are just a bunch of angles.2) Some of the lines were pretty bad ie. "Time for the remix.." during the insult scene.3) Some un-necessary CG scenes were in the movie, which got most of the complaints, but it wasn't too bad.Other than that.. the movie was pretty entertaining from my point of view. DON'T EXPECT A LOT!I for one like this movie, I guess it's because I'm a fan of Halle Berry.3/5 (Decent summer flick, go see it to be entertained, nothing more, nothing less)

A nice fun film if you are going out with some friends. The feel of the film is much more urban than Catwoman portrayed by Michelle Pfeiffer. Halle Berry is entertaining as the shy, retiring Patience Philips, which makes her transformation even more jubilant. Stone is enjoyable as the aging model, Wilson is scheming as her husband Hedare. However enjoyable it is to watch, there are some flaws to the film as a whole. The characters seem less than convincing some of the time Frances Conroy's (usually fantastic in Six Feet Under) Ophelia comes across as a crazy cat lady and the Hedares seem a little too evil to be true. If you add the slightly barmy plot hinge (face cream kills!!!), there are some major problems for the more finicky viewer. However if you like your films light and campy this is for you.

I've seen worse movies than what Catwoman was, like Dude, Where's My Car and all that.I'll admit there were bad points in the movie, but not enough for it to get the extent of criticism it got upon release.I'm guessing that a sequel is totally banned.The action and effects were good, although if they had cast Catwoman to Angelina Jolie and Laurel to...I dunno...Tia Carrere (she can be pretty bitchy) ...Anyway...I quite enjoyed it for the most part.Just because it was a woman hero, and the villain was crap, it still made enough money to re-line a cat's poop tray.And the name of Catwoman, PATIENCE PHILLIPS!!, Where did that come from! And they had the cheek to credit it under Bob Kane's name.And the name Laurel Hedare is just plain cheesy for a villain!

Firstly, Halle Barry is absolutely hot in the leather outfit that she wore.Now to the reason that I am writing this. The movie sucked. There was too much computer graphics used in the making of this film.Furthermore, there are also too many camera angles used throughout the film and it tends to get confusing. But over all the movie was by far one of the worst movies that I have ever seen.I would like to recommend that you should not buy this movie. If you really what to see this film, rent it. Then after you watch it, pass it around to friends that *claim* they want to see this CRAP.

I do not and will never know why everyone despises this movie. But I can take my best guess at it. But first, let me say that I loved this movie. Halle Barry does a brilliant job switching between the personalities of catwoman and patience philips. Sharon Stone is an interesting villain, who actually has a personality! There is a dearth of that in villains these days. But it does have it's problems. I think that most people's problems with it is that it's not Michelle Pfeiffer in her skin tight leather outfit. it's halle Barry in a more revealing one. But the reason for it not being the batman catwoman is in the movie. The other problem is the costume. It's just a little too over the top and a tad ridiculous. The final problem is the plot. It's stupid. Killer cosmetics! But, if you can look past it's flaws, you will see a great superhero movie!

Alright there are a lot of points to hit on this one so well start small. First, catwomans name, in almost all of the batman comics here name is Selena Kyle. So what does the writer of this unfortunate movie call its main protagonist? Patience Phillips. Nice try but no. Second is the catwoman costume. It is so dumb looking that a dominatrix would think she looked silly. At first the costume looked alright but then Halle cut it up all to hell and it is bad. The movie sucks just a heads up. But it doesn't even suck in a the room, sharknadio kind of way because you get the feeling that it had the potential to be great. Instead they ruin it the minute it starts, one by telling us the protagonist dies in this movie but gets resurrected so spoiler I guess. The whole part of the movie up intel she gets her powers is pointless as all of it just stands to set of contrast for when she does get her powers. And it's not a really compelling ether. She finds this one chick who tells her that her powers are from Egyptian goddess. Then you never see her again. She's not an Alfred that might serve as a guide even though she knows everything about Catwoman apparently. So after that she dedicates the rest of the movie to attempting to stop the company she works for from selling evil makeup. That really has only on downside that it ruins your face if you stop using it. But I mean big deal just don't stop using it because it will make your skin rock hard if you apply it regularly. Sell that to the Military and everyone's happy. Moving on I hope you love cat jokes and puns because they are everywhere. Not cleaver puns and jokes like batman returns and batman Arkham city or the comic books. Nope these are bottom of the barrel dumb jokes that no one wants to here or see. Example she sniffs catnip. That is really in the movie she also sleeps on shelfs and eats tuna. Actually in the movie. I don't know how you take a character that was almost perfect for a movie and just kill it this bad. This movie doused all hopes for future movies about catwoman. Good catwoman not this. This is the zilla to Godzilla. I really do hope that one day there will be a reboot that might do this character justice
Worst superheroes movie ever. Story is so bad written.

There simply are no words to adequately describe how horrific this movie is. At least not in the English language and while trying to abstain from the use of profanities. I feel like Klingon might possibly be the only language which possesses enough adjectives that would befit this movie.It'd be a different story if this were a flick for kids, but that's clearly not the target audience here. Since I don't take any drugs, I can't attest to the potential enjoyment factor of watching this while stoned, but I doubt it would be sufficient.Unless you're able to derive a worrisome amount of enjoyment from staring at Halle Barry's airbrushed cleavage, stay away from this. Or at least get a lobotomy beforehand. Your cat might end up hating you for watching this.
I forgot how bad this movie was. Happened to be scrolling the channels and it was on. Terrible acting, horrible story... just plain pathetic.

reviews.review_title: I didn't realise how bad it was
reviews.content: The problem with catwoman is the lame and I mean lame as in non existent script, I am not sure who the director was but he'd never work in my town again. You cannot blame the actors as they can only work with what they are given. first off the costume fro catwoman sucks big time, it should have been more fetish, figure hugging, shiny no skin showing all covered up just like the comic but plenty of curves to show, that would have helped, even a blind man could have made that costume look sexy, methinks the script was written by a gay! As for Halle's walk well it looks like she's got a pineapple stuck up her butt! All in all it's a real stinker but it could have been oh so good had they played it for laughs and not tried to take themselves to seriously but the film is a joke, shoot the director and the studio heads for letting it go out.

reviews.review_title: A travesty of a comic hero
reviews.content: Yes, I too saw this movie. It's a travesty. For one thing I think they ripped off DC Comics, because Selina Kyle is the REAL name of Catwoman. And last time I checked, she was a thief who stole from wealthy people, not an artist. Catwoman used to be one of my favorite DC Comics characters because she wasn't a hero, but she wasn't really a villain either. And by the way, the REAL Catwoman NEVER acted like a REAL cat. She may have had cat-like reflexes, but she was still as human as Batman/Bruce Wayne.This movie actually lowered my IQ. I dunno why, but I saw it twice, at the time I thought, "Hey, maybe it'll be better the second time around." I was wrong. As for the story, god forbid something in this movie make sense. I believe Carlos Mencia has a phrase for something like this, "Dee Dee Dee!"All said, I rate this movie a 1, because they won't allow me to rate any lower.

reviews.review_title: Halle Berry is gorgeous, but not a convincing Catwoman
reviews.content: Yes, Lord, Halle Berry is gorgeous and sexy. She fills out her "catsuit" like few actresses can. She has the best lips/mouth/teeth in Hollywood. Pitof made sure we got a full dose of that. But Sharon Stone, actually, would have been more convincing as the Catwoman. Yes, she is no teenager, but she still has the body, looks, and pure evil/sweet disposition to have pulled it off. Her fall at the end was SO MUCH Michael Douglas in "The Game", I felt slighted that Rebeck couldn't come up with something a bit more original for our villain's death-fall. Courtney Cox-Arquette would have made an excellent choice as the villain to Stone's Catwoman. Even though she is a bit young to be using the youth cream, there are plenty more victims to demonstrate it's horrifying side-effects. Also, someone with George Hedare's (Lambert Wilson's) ego would have certainly taken a much younger wife. Either way, the movie isn't as good as I had hoped, but has decent special effects and sharp cinematography. Worth watching just so see Halle in the catsuit and Kim Smith for her one speaking part and 10 minutes of fame.

The president of a cosmetics company, whose youthful face has successfully served as proof of the superiority of her product line, is at last aging. Falling sales ensue and threaten the very company she worked so hard to build.She banks the company's future and her own fading beauty on a wonder product which promises to maintain her legendary beauty and make billions for her company.Several in the company are suspicious and attempt to investigate. They wind up dead. Soon, it's discovered that the miracle product that she is about to mass market to the world, has some serious and deadly side-effects. The secret formula has turned the company president into a monster.Once the flaw in the company rejuvenation plan is discovered a fight between the company president and an employee ensues with the once beautiful president, now turned monster, eventually vanquished by being forced out of the window of the company's high-rise office building.The above synopsis is a description Roger Corman's 1959 B-horror classic THE WASP WOMAN.

I somehow managed to avoid this movie until last weekend, when I was stuck in the house with a bad head cold and was desperate for entertainment.I love Berry, but I almost think that they should make her give her Oscar back as punishment. Benjamin Bratt should be spanked (I volunteer!) for accepting that valiant-yet-amazingly- uninteresting-cop role. And Sharon Stone... well, let's say that they must have spent a fortune replacing the scenery, seeing as how she spent so much of the movie chewing it.In fact, lack of funds is the only possible explanation for the laughable cheesy CG... not to mention the craptastic script.How bad was it? I am personally offended that this movie exists and anyone who so much as delivered coffee to the set of this stinker owes me an apology.

Aaaargh! Why can't I be an actor? Or a director, a movie maker, a cameraman? It seems so easy to make a movie watching this... The plot is absurd and rusty. Dialogues are almost like Teenage Mutant Hero Turtles! By the way, only in my opinion, Halle Berry act as a monkey. Nothing about the "real" sensation of discovering new unnatural powers! Oh no! It's easy! You wake up in a morning and...meow! (It is incredible: someone wanted to find similitudes with Spiderman!...Oh shut up!) How the cats bring her to life? Why they made it? Which is the aim of the cats or the One Cat? Who is the cat's Lady?Have you seen a bit of racism? She is black, the detective is black (his good friend is black), her friends are black! The villain is white, the bad mistress is white, even when she is in the jail all of the cops are gentle but one, a big ugly white cop! Only her friend is white... a stupid, fat, sex hunger and then sick white girl! Maybe is only in my impression..."This is after all a film that has to appeal to a teenage audience" said someone...Finally, if in my opinion a movie is a bad movie can I say it or have I to say "Oooh it's beautiful" in order to seem not slave of critics?SAVE YOUR MONEY!Waiting for reply...and money refund!
This film has nothing to show for appart from casting Hale Berry

The directing, acting, screenplay, sound design, sound mixing, soundtrack, choreography and visual effects are all awful. What typically makes these things good in a movie is when you don't notice them at all, but in Catwoman each aspect is done so poorly you'd have to be dead not to notice. With exception to the dialog which is painful to endure, most of Catwoman's faults are in it's poorly done post production work. If you're a Halle Berry fan you will be very disappointed but you can't blame her or Benjamin Bratt (I am fans of both) as it seems that they did the absolute best with what they were given; it's just a shame that a sub par team of post supervisors and a second hand job of directing could make a couple of top notch actors looks so bad. Don't waste your time unless you want to talk through the whole movie about how bad it is.

I saw Catwoman today and I didn't go in expecting much and I came out not enjoying it that much either. Halle Berry looks gorgeous as always but the costume she wears looks absurd and does not resemble Catwoman's original costume at all. It's OK with me if dialouge in a comic movie is corny but the stuff in this was to much for my taste. Sharon Stone gives a nice campy performance thats somewhat enjoyable but besides that nothing much interested me in this movie. It could have been good as just an action movie but even the action in it falls flat. The final fight between Stone and Berry could have been much better than it was. It ends up being being quick and not exciting to watch.

This film is, to be frank, awful. The bad graphics and impossible storyline top it off, but there are also the tired old stereotypes. The rather larger best friend and the camp guy who add snippy comments to everything the poor, downtrodden but 'really talented' and amazingly beautiful protagonist says. The most ridiculous part was definitely the mau cat breathing its smelly green 'cat life' into her after she is dead which, being a super hero movie, wouldn't be so bad if the graphics weren't so terrible. however, i grudgingly like this film for two stupid reasons 1 is that i watched on sky movies at Christmas when i was ill and it cheered me up, and so does so now 2 is that i love the breathy, exotic, incense-burning, cat-loving character of Ophelia Powers. Therefore, i make this film my guilty pleasure, but still give it 4 out of 10 (:

This re-vamp of the legendary catwoman franchise is what the general viewing audience has been waiting for! Catwomen succeeds on many levels but I think the most dominant one is where it reaches audiences members who are fans of comics, but also who are maybe just fans of cats. Or perhaps a Berry-Head or two? Either way, its a fantastic piece of cinematic interpretation! And Im not just saying that because I was good friends with Director Pitof, its truly something to behold. With a soundtrack composed by Depache Mode with Eden Ahbez on the bass, its not one to be missed. Although Kim Smith's acting is dry as always, her bit of "acting" shouldn't hinder you from renting this summer time flick the whole family can enjoy!

Since its release I was avoiding this movie because of its bad reviews. However I watched it out of boredom recently, and I must say, I wonder why it was rated THAT bad.Sure it's no masterpiece, but in my honest opinion it at least deserves to be called 'nice'.The film draws a slightly different image of Catwoman. But thats okay. This is not supposed to be the story of Selina Kyle after all. Patience Phillips is in many regards quite unlike Kyle, so it would only be natural for this Catwoman to differ significantly from the original one.The one thing I am criticizing the most is, that the plot has to less time to unfold. Everything seems a bit rushed. That's a common illness to movies of the 21st century. But I don't think CGI was used all too much. It is allowed to use some modern technology after all, isn't it?And for the closing: I have no idea how Halle Berry got that 'worst actress' Razzie Award. She might have overacted some prancing on the rooftops. But to me that's just cartoon, and to be smiled on amused. 'Yes Kitty you ARE a Feline Femme Fatale.'

reviews.review_title: Worst superhero, action movie of all time!!!!!!
reviews.content: This has to be on the top 10 worst hyped-movies of all time. I'm regretting even buying a ticket and supporting its box office toll. Please don't make the same mistake I did. Wait for the DVD or better yet wait till it comes to TV, which should not be too long. Even before I went to watch this movie I was warned that it would be really bad. I was curious to see how bad it was + I wanted to see Halle Berry. Trust me, its not even worth that. Heck I wouldn't see it again if I was given a free ticket for the movie. I was literally bored to death 15 minutes into the movie. If you really must see a movie, go watch Bourne Supremacy instead.

reviews.review_title: The scenes of Catwoman crouched on the rooftops of the city
reviews.content: Made me long for Dark Angel...ah, those were the days. Jessica Alba didn't need a cat suit to kick ass, although as I recall she did wear black leather on occasion and rode a motorcycle...hmmmm. She also had the whole 'going into heat thing', again similar to feline behavior. Rrrrrrrrrrrrrr! Benjamin Bratt seemed to be playing the same character from Miss Congeniality. I did like the basketball and carnival scenes. But what was Frances Conroy doing? She should have been written a little darker, in my opinion...the school-marm hairdo just wasn't working for me. Other than that, the movie just seemed to be a 1 hour, 40 minute-long Revlon commercial, not that Halle doesn't wear it well.

reviews.review_title: A waste of time and money
reviews.content: This is an awful film, looking slightly like something they'd show on MTV's TRL. This hack-job of a story is all about a graphic artist who is killed and re-awoken by an ancient force...blah blah blah. Not only does this film have nothing to do with Batman Returns , it's an awful story just for a genre film. The story itself is enough to have you rolling your eyes. The character's names (Patience Phillips, Tom Lone) are even goofier. The over-the-top cat-costume makes Halle Berry look like a mouse. Worse still, the movie has nothing to do with the comic book character. However, it happily rips off much better works (such as the first two Batman films and The Crow). A scene in which Halle chomps down sushi pretty much says it all. Unsurprisingly, Ebert has given it one star and the film won't make more more than $13 mil this weekend. Ouch.In short: Don't waste your time.

It has been proven that superheros can be transfered from comic strip to screen quite successfully, spiderman 1+2, x-men, even superman had a bash. however this is not one of these times. This is not only a poor superhero film but a poor film all round. Its up there with other crappy efforts like The Hulk and spawn. Catwoman suffers from a few major drawbacks, The first is that the plot is pants! what were the script writers thinking? Mad crazy person wanting to cause havoc by using a killer face cream!!! my god.Secondly the direction and editing is just plain poor. the director does'nt focus on one shot for more than a few seconds making it hard to follow whats going on and quite frankly making you feel ill.And finally (well there are more reasons but i only have so many words) the cgi is poor and unbelievable. which would be OK if it wasn't so frequent in the film, but its full of it.All in all this film will be loved by teenagers who think halle is fit jumping around (hate to break it to you it was a bloke doing her stunts), boys who cant get girls, and girls who think its great to see halle kick arse. ultimately its crap. Don't waste you pennies going to see it at the cinema!!!!.

I thought this movie would really be something. It wasn't all that great. The plot totally sucked. I do love Sharon Stone as an actress. So, she did make the movies funny in a few parts. I would only recommend this movie to those who really "want" to waste their time. The plot was also sort of slow. I dunno I guess it was the time I went to see it. I went pretty late, so I "guess" that would account for the fact that I am so mad I completely wasted 8.50 on a movie that I really did not want to see in the first place. If anyone did like this movie, please write me back and tell me the parts that were so good, that I obviously missed. I am mad I spent that much money. Thank you very much.

Alright, I'm not going to give away much, but this wasn't as bad as I thought it was going to be. Storyline had a good telling of a woman becoming A Catwoman, but to all those Gotham Fans...Don't go see this expecting Batman's Adversary/Love Interest. GO see this as a WHOLE new take on a Rouge Female given the abilities of a cat. One of my Co-workers said this was (to her) a near Rip off of "Dark Angel."AS for me, They could have had stunt women doing more of the Leaps and Jumps in the movie. I say could of, but They SHOULD have. I don't mind the occasional CGI effects and actions, but this movie had rather poor quality in CGI'ing Catwoman. It also had TO Much CGI i think. Most movies these days Do, and to me that takes away from the movie and the actors. We're suppose to be impressed by what a computer can do over a real humans ability to act, but that's an entirely different Argument for another time.Overall: I liked the movie.

reviews.review_title: Whoa! Can I have those two hours of my life back?
reviews.content: Sadly...No, I can't. A friend of mine paid for my ticket so I didn't feel so bad coming into it, but then after, I wanted those two hours back. I could have watched something worthwhile or just slept for two hours. Now that would have been better..sleep! The movie had potential, that is what is so sad. It had Halle Berry in a leather suit with a whip! I don't understand how they could go wrong. They even had Sharon Stone. Now if you wanted to see it for purely guy reasons, go ahead. It seemed like that was quite a focus.*SPOILER* Halle Berry is playing basketball and she is just shaking' her butt at the camera and the scenes with her in the suit were up close a lot of the time and seemed somewhat out of place. Like they were just putting those parts in for the effects and the close-up on her chest. Another thing that is just weird is that they said they were trying to stray from what has been done previously. It does change but then they just pop in the "purrrrfect!" They bite off so many things it's funny. Another thing is that she was doing so many cat things that she lost a lot of her catwoman class. Eating much tuna and scarfing fish. Not even real cats scarf like that, the ones I have seen eat very daintily. ONE OF THE MAIN REASONS I WANTED TO SEE IT WAS BECAUSE SHE COULD GET REVENGE ON THOSE WHO KILLED HER. NOT REALLY REVENGE....JUST LAME!!!

reviews.review_title: It was OK---But only because I'm a 16 year old guy.
reviews.content: Okay, here is the unbiased scoop. If you know your history, mine being as little as a Batman toon on Cartoon Network, then you know that Catwoman is a crook. She steals for personal gain, and is just....well, bad. That, in itself, is unmarketable. Screenwriters know this, but they also know that Halle Berry wearing tight black leather and using her model strut while representing the most universal symbol of femininity, the cat, does sell VERY well. So what do they do? They come up with a totally fabricated plot to twist Catwoman into a sort of dark hero. That alone cheapens the movie, but hey it's your call. As for the actual movie, It's alright. There's nothing great, but nothing is really bad either. The story isn't genius, but it carries it's weight. It does a good job to provide motives for Patience's/Catwoman's actions. The Characters are normal people, which is okay. Except for Catwoman, and a few major antagonists, everyone can pass for real people.The acting is great if you consider the fact that this is an action movie, so none of the lines require talent. I do applaud Halle in her roles because she really gives you the feel of someone being transformed into a new person over night.I think you get the idea. I give it a 7 because it wasn't a letdown, like say Daredevil. It is hard to expect much of the superhero genre, but Catwoman passed. I don't expect the average woman to like this movie because it is a way to average, but for any fan (straight guy/lesbian) of Halle, I recommend it. They knew what they were doing, and Halle is so good at doing it.

catwoman is a poor attempt of making another comic book hero become real. I mean everyone wants to jump on the spiderman wagon. Catwomen totally misses. with it's boring story line and characters like a very aging Sharon Stone, looking like a pale scarecrow, this movie was a waste. There were some OK special effects and Halle Berry does look great, but it was not enough to hold together the movie. do yourself a favor and wait for it to come to your local pay per view station in about two months, you will save time and money. I really hope that we will get a great movie this summer, i think the Bourne Supremacy looks like a good bet, so i will give my review soon.

reviews.review_title: Good campy fun ... take your teen
reviews.content: Although purists can argue the merits of a Catwoman without a Batman for a foil and rail away all day about racism, those arguments are irrelevant. This movie is just supposed to be a bit of a lark, and it accomplishes that. It proved to be a good bit of fun for an afternoon escape and the makers have no reason to feel guilty for putting this diversion in theaters. Halle Berry is at her best as she discovers her new powers. Once she's in full costume, this show goes completely campy. The obvious advantages to cat-like grace and stealth are portrayed humorously in this flick. Ms Berry deserves an appreciative nod for her efforts in that regard. The CGI effects are pretty cheesy in the latter half, but I appreciate that it saved me the price of a Spiderman ticket, having gotten enough swooping over and around buildings to make another trip to the theater redundant. If Hollywood can avoid making a sequel here, that'd be good. My teenage daughter thoroughly enjoyed it and that's fine with me. I appreciated that the producers managed to put another goofy adventure film out there that didn't glorify gun violence. They put out another strong female role model on film and that's another plus. I'd give this 7 or 8 stars out of ten, knocking off two for the CGI and miscasting Alex Boorstein as the heroine's pal. Alex was pretty good on MadTV but detracts a bit from this one.

The negative hype that is. This movie was entertaining, exciting and full of action. Of course some of the story was unrealistic but come on, it's a movie about a "Cat Woman"! Honestly, how bad can a movie be if its cast includes Halle Berry, Benjamin Bratt and Sharon Stone?Everyone is pushing Matt Damon's Bourne Supremacy, please tell me why? I'll fell asleep watching The Bourne Identity!Halle did an amazing job, she was the best Catwoman I've seen since Miss Eartha - All hail the Queen or the Cat!Well done Halle, I'll see it again!

Despite the fact that Catwoman is a Sci-Fi film, it should still have some realism. The fact that Benjamin Bratt's character is dating Halle Berry's character and doesn't notice a similarity between her and Cat Woman, the villain he's chasing, is preposterous. They look exactly the same, as in hair, build, voice, and her way of speaking, except for a thin, black band. A band not covering her whole face but just the area around her eyes. This is not my only reason for despising Cat Woman. It had a crappy story-line, well come to think of it there is no story. At least one worth any recognition. This movie was a total waste of Halle Berry's blooming talent.[Mara Jade Ownz]

reviews.review_title: VERY FUNNY!!! -- ALMOST A CAMP CLASSIC!!!
reviews.content: In this movie, Halle Berry plays a young artist named Charity who enjoys running headlong into other people (apparently she's a masochist like Maggie Gyllenhaal's character in 'Secretary' -- given her taste in leather and whips, she might have more in common with this character, as well). Anyhoo, Chastity runs afoul of evil cosmetic makers (no, I'm being serious here), who have her killed! Fortunately, a magical cat brings Prudence back to life, except with all these neato cat-powers. Such as being really good at playing basketball, wielding a whip, cutting hair, and riding a motorcycle ('cause we all know how good cats are at these things!) She also starts actually BEHAVING like a cat, doing things that Garfield would do like wearing tight leather and stealing jewels. Nothing really happens in the movie, but along the way you get these really hee-larious lines that will have you blowing Coke out of your nose: "How purrrr (SNORT!!!) fect!" "Get your paws off me!" "There goes my jumpshot!" (You can't really overstress the importance of basketball in a movie about a woman with cat powers!)Predictably, at the end, there is a, ermmm, catfight between Prudence and the evil head of the cosmetic company, played by Sharon Stone. No contest you say? Well, Sharon's been bogarting this secret beauty formula that not only disguises the fact that she's like 100 years old, but turns her skin like ROCK HARD! So Hope has to watch those nails while she's fighting! But, ultimately (SPOILERS ALERT, yawn) Catwoman throws Sharon to her death from a tall building -- the only surprise for me here being that Sharon doesn't break apart into a million brittle pieces like that guard in 'Top Secret!' Aside from me nearly falling asleep during the "love" scene and almost walking out in disgust during the basketball scene, I must say it was pretty fun. Three and a half stars. Check it out, but only if you enjoyed 'Beyond the Valley of the Dolls'!

reviews.review_title: Very poor script and action sequences are laughable.
reviews.content: Catwoman (2004)Stars: Halle Berry, Benjamin Bratt, Lambert Wilson and Sharon Stone.Plot: Shy and clumsy artist Patience Phillips (Halle Berry) works for Hedare cosmetic firm owned by George (Lambert Wilson) and wife Laurel Hedare (Sharon Stone). Overhearing something she shouldn't have she is left for dead but is brought back to life by an ancient cat and is now cursed with the speed, reflexes and senses of a cat transforming into the leather clad, crimefighting superhero Catwoman. Pursued by cop Tom Lone (Benjamin Bratt), She sets out to find who tried to kill her.Comments:A Spin-off from the Batman movies, This movie was pretty hyped up for a couple of years but it just doesn't do justice here. Halle Berry is not putting much into the role but it is good to see Sharon Stone giving her shot as the villain. But this is just not good at all.2/10* out of *****The Reviewer

reviews.review_title: Some observations I haven't seen on the reviews so far
reviews.content: I have read the review on the movie posted on the site. I find it quite optimistic in terms of the quality of the movie. I have just seen the movie, and I have to say that it is really awful. It is a sum of clichés made in Hollywood. There have been a lot of movies recently with their story taken from the comic books. I did not see them all, but this one seems the worst.And another thing I want to add. The character "Catwoman" was created by BobKane (correct me if I'm wrong, because I am not really sure on that) to support the "Batman" character. In this movie it is taken out of context and by my opinion it is weakened a lot. Catwoman without Batman becomes just a dull stereotype.

I'm with the general consensus in the fact that this movie was just horrible. And it's not just because they forced clichés into a can of sardines, or that the characters were weak, or that none of it was even slightly believable. It's the fact that nothing worked! I mean nothing! They got one of the greatest female actresses around, paired with one of the most annoying (the madtv one)? The jokes, if you want to call them that, were lame. The clichés ('cat got your tongue', and countless others) were more out of place than catwoman herself. The previews made it look like it was gonna be half decent, but it wasn't even that. Man, i liked watching the cats better than the rest of the movie, and i hate cats.

reviews.review_title: So glad I had low expectations
reviews.content: I was dragged to see "Catwomen" by a mate of mine. I had heard how bad it was, so I had absolutely no expectations of it being on the same planet as anything good. So from this point of view I was neither surprised or disappointed.Oscar Winner(!) Halle Berry delivers a performance that would make the grade in a daytime soap but not much else. In my opinion she didn't even work as a piece of eye candy, that suit was just ugly. As for the rest Benjamin Bratt was wooden and Sharon Stone, just plain horrible.Finally the director Pitof (riight) did nothing to even remotely excite. I've had more thrilling maths classes (really I have). Luckily he can use a different name for his next film. (Pitof is a nickname).I am just so thankful I had low expectations for "Catwomen" or I would be way more angry at it and the people that made it then I am now.

I would have given more stars if the guard had brought a litter box when Cat woman was locked up. Also, when Cat woman says to Sharon Stone, who is swinging from a bar high up, "give me a hand"...then Sharon Stone tries to clap her hands but falls to her big splat. And at the end of the movie, show Cat woman's apartment couch all scratched up. Looking forward to Dog woman, Iguana woman, turtle woman (probably be real slow), potato bug woman, hippo woman (staring Rosanne), sloth woman (staring one of the Kardashians), kangaroo woman (story line bounces all around), and on and on. I do understand the attraction Catwoman has to Bratt....being in kitty heat.

I have just seen this movie. What a stinker. This is the worst written movie that I have seen in a long, long time. One nightmare, that I will have for the rest of my life is the basketball scene'. The basketball scene was an attempt, (I really do mean an attempt, because it failed...miserably) at the playful scene in Daredevil, where Garner and Affleck test their mettle. The character never really sold the idea of developing her newly found powers. Is was a 'look what I did' vs. 'I did I do that?' I cannot believe the writer actually wrote for Law and Order, but then again the key word is wrote. The writing was terrible, I have no idea why the director didn't yell cut every line, asking for a re-write. I have never ever before wrote a bad comment about a movie, but this one, I need to tell everyone to approach with extreme caution and do not expect to be entertained.DH

The special effects are bad. The costume designer for the cat suit really hates Berry! Whomever decided to use Eartha Kitt to narrate the special feature on the history of Cat Woman, should be shot. that woman is ugly, has a voice that puts nails on a blackboard to shame and radiates arrogance!How can you write ten lines on this movie?Not even worth a DVD to copy!Waste of time.Darn, I could watched Ishtar!Or even Waterworld!

reviews.review_title: Nowhere near as bad as I thought.. actually, pretty good!
reviews.content: First off, can I say I thought Spider-man 2 was dreadful.I mean, I wasn't too struck on the first, but I thought the special effects were great and Tobey Maguire acted his little socks off. But no.2? Nah, something wasn't right. So it was with great trepidation that I put that Catwoman disc in my player on a Sunday afternoon and sat down with my trashy cinema buddy and a bowl of popcorn to watch what hyped as the worst film of 2004. I mean, I hated Spider-man 2 which many regarded as a masterpiece... what hope did Catwoman hold?Lots, actually. I found myself really enjoying the movie.. a hell of a lot more than Spider-man 2.Sure Catwoman is campy and trashy. Sure it's pantomime. But it's also a comic book. People tend to forget that. The whole thing came across in a really comic book style and was much more watchable than the old web crawler. Catwoman knows it's glossy forgettable fluff and doesn't self indulge in pithy sentimentality. I got sick to death of Peter Parker's moral preaching... I didn't watch Catwoman for a lecture, I watched it to see Catwoman kicking butt.And kick butt she does. Halle Berry is perfectly cast here, as being an Oscar winner, she can actually pull of the range of emotions needed to convey Catwoman's multi faceted personality. You believe when she's meak and timid as Patience Phillips. You can totally empathise with fun she's having when first playing with her new found cat powers. And boy does she look like she can kick ass as a full fledged Catwoman.Now I gotta admit, I saw Halle's costume back at the start of 2004 and thought.. Minnie Mouse? Thought she was doing Catwoman? Well turns out that costume isn't so bad after all. They couldn't keep the Pfeifer one and with the premise that Catwoman is just an moniker that is passed down through the ages, if each Catwoman is different, why not each costume. It looked sexy, daring almost military. A real urban outfit. I forgot the ears after a while.The rest of the cast are variable in their contributions. Benjamin Bratt as Berry's love interest has the most thankless role. A by-the-numbers dumb cop (who just happens to be assigned to every incident that Catwoman is involved in) who even when Catwoman is an inch from his face, doesn't recognise the breasts that were lying on top of him the previous night! So much for police diligence! Sharon Stone is icy cool as the villainous Laurel Hedare whose relationship with her playboy husband George (Lambert Wilson) is an interesting but never fully realised story arc. Wilson's screen time is brief, but he's outshined by Stone, who plays the bitch with relish. At 40+ she still looks great and her final hand to hand fight with Catwoman proves she's in good shape.I was prepared to hate Catwoman. I kept telling myself it was awful, but then instantly correcting myself. As a superhero movie it was great - it pushed all the right buttons. As an action movie - forgettable, but enjoyable fluff. If you haven't seen it, rent the DVD, you may find your self purrleasantly surprised.

One thing that really made me mad were the graphics in the movie. Technology is advanced enough that we do not need to use so many computerized images. Catwoman Review
	Catwoman is full of eye candy that has its moments, but it is nothing more than that. It plays like a very poorly written and executed rough draft of a script.
	Catwoman is about a woman named Patience Phillips. Patience ends up coming between a line of hero and villain when she becomes Catwoman. She develops catlike characteristics after she's resurrected by a cat after she's drowned
	   Catwoman has actors who are good, nice looking actors Halle Berry and Benjamin Bratt and other relatively good-looking actors in it. One of the very alluring aspects of Catwoman is when we see what looks like a picture of Michelle Pfeiffer as Catwoman. This makes us wonder if somehow Catwoman is set in the same universe as the film Batman Returns where Michelle Pfeiffer played Catwoman in. 
	There are so many flaws in Catwoman that it plays like a rough draft of a screenplay. The cop in the picture Tom Lone's last name has symbolism to it because he's a loner or vigilante. He's a policeman who doesn't like to have a partner and he likes to work alone. I however can't see analogy in the protagonist Patience Phillips name she seems to be more eager than patient. When she sees a cat on a roof, she's very eager to rescue it and doesn't really think about the consequences of saving it or how she could save it.
I also would have liked if it really showed Tom Lone as a loner by not having him work with any other cops' period. The romantic relationship between Patience and Tom isn't very convincing. It comes across as if they should have a romantic relationship just because he saved her and, not because they have genuinely deep feelings for each other. Tom and Patience don't seem to really respect each other by deciding that they should have coffee together on a day when they both must go to work instead of deciding to have coffee together when they have time off from work. I would have liked it better if Lone had an authentically passionate relationship with both Patience Phillips and Catwoman. 
	Catwoman plays like the 2002 version of Spiderman about a man who develops spider like characteristics after he's bitten by a radioactive spider, and Catwoman in Catwoman even climbs up walls like Spiderman. It also has some essentials of Basic Instinct. Tom wakes up with a scratch on his back after him and Patience make love a similar thing happens in Basic Instinct with the male lead having scratches on his back. Tom leaves Patience a letter after they make love and Catherine leaves Nick a note after they make love.
	Catwoman comes across as if it's a rough draft that borrowed or stole off everything else to be made.

You know how audiences dismiss DC's Extended Universe movies? Well, these kids have never seen arguably the most miraculously terrible and disappointing waste of opportunity that is Catwoman, an origin story which was supposed to be for the DC villain like what Joker did far better fifteen years later. However, this one features Patience Phillips (Halle Berry), a cosmetology graphics designer who gets killed in the sewers, brought back to life by cats, and discovers her new identity as Catwoman. However, the owners George and Laurel Hedare (Lambert Wilson and Sharon Stone), who discover Patience still alive, want to wipe her out from existence once again, label her as the villain, and launch their makeup that hardens skin. Unlike Joker where his progression toward evil, violence, and anarchy deemed believable, Catwoman's villainous motives aren't at all clear as throughout the film she utters insufferable cat puns, does all sorts of obvious cat-like behavior (i.e. eating canned tuna, sniffing catnip, making purring sounds, and landing on her feet), and dates the oblivious cop Tom Lone (Benjamin Bratt). Speaking of, how can this guy not figure out that Patience is also the sexy feline heroine, even though her cursive handwritings, cat-like antics, and lipstick matches are so laughably obvious? Furthermore, the movie tries too hard to be visually diverse, using way too many composite shots, ugly motion capture movements, nauseating jump cuts, and glossy metal and brass tones. With Pitof's overabundance of style-over-substance nuance, the movie seems more like playing a Playstation 2 video game featuring one of those cube-like humanoids with triangle breasts and skimpy slutty outfits. Even as a retcon origin story about one of DC's best Batman villains, Catwoman is one heap of kitty litter worth scooping out and dumping in the bin. (1 White Russian [no ice, hold the vodka, hold the Kahlua] out of 5)

There is a great deal of hate and criticism towards this movie, with good reason. I do not understand why Halle Berry wanted to do this movie, her reputation as a former Oscar winner cannot benefit from doing movies like Swordfish, Die Another Day, and this. I do understand why Halle Berry landed the role of the confident Catwoman clad in all black, but that is only half of the role. Berry flounders as her secret identity of Patience Phillips, who is a meek struggling graphic designer nerd shoved in a cubicle. The two-sided character of Catwoman could make for a complex hero and anti-hero, but heavy-handed storytelling ruins that too. The movie implies that there was a long line of women throughout the ages selected for a double life of power and freedom. The movie neglects to play up this interesting concept. How the main character earns that privilege, the transfer of that power, and how she learns about her new abilities fall short. These important plot elements are all lazy, flat, and shameless exposition. The overbearing soundtrack makes it seem like this is all a bad second-rate Destiny's Child music video. Scenes with her male love interest are particularly painful and feel like a daytime soap opera. Making the character scarf down fish, hating rain, and hissing at dogs is also too much, even for humorous relief. The villain role played by Sharon Stone is dull. She appears to be thinking manipulative corporate type of villain. She plans to release addictive cosmetics that slowly destroy people without continuing its use. Suddenly, in a plot hole the size of Texas, she reveals that the same toxic cosmetics made her superhuman and feel no pain. Poor decision-making by the director along with the Halle Berry's lack of acting range kill this movie. I will stick with Michelle Pfeiffer's Catwoman, thank you.

I watched Halle Berry's Catwoman before I watched Michelle Pfeiffer's, and I gotta say; Halle makes for one smokin' hot Catwoman. So I did not know of Catwoman's connection to Batman until after I saw Batman Returns a few years ago. I agree, that the film would've been better if they stuck to the Batman origins. But the acting was off in some scenes and Sharon Stone's character had a pathetic motive and was under-explored. The actors that were chosen for their respective roles weren't bad choices, but they still lacked in the acting-department. The plotline was weak, though Halle's fighting scenes were excellent. The beauty product that featured prominently was badly named and complete bullshit. Cosmetics companies must test their products for all types of side-effects before it becomes available to the public, cuz it's consumer-law, and usually it's an independent firm that does the testing. The product's name, Bea-u-line, doesn't roll of the tongue as easily as a cosmetics-giant would want it to, plus it's a terrible name, unimaginative. Patience' role as a graphic-designer/artist was under-explored, since she assumed the Catwoman identity quite early in the film. I like the way they used Egyptian folklore as Catwoman's origins, but this contradicts her real origins in Batman. The idea of Catwoman having ''cat-powers'' is lame, they could just easily describe her as a very flexible, agile and competent fighter, no special powers needed. Costume-wise, that cat-suit is glorious. Unlike Michelle's cat-suit in Batman, it depicts exactly what Catwoman (in general) is all about: Confidence, Seduction and Power. On the plus side for men, it provides us with a whole lotta eye-candy. The only reason why most men will watch this film is cuz of Halle Berry's moves in that cat-suit. People say that men are only after looks, that's true, but most of us also go for the personality, and let's not forget that women also go after the looks. And a confident woman (whether sexual or not) are very attractive to men. That cat-suit would make any race of woman look incredibly sexy, fortunately, Halle's skin was just the right tone to match the suit perrrrfectly. Her ''dance routine'' during the club-scene was well planned and well executed, her whip's movements was spectacularly well choreographed and nicely done. Halle Berry as Catwoman was brilliant in every way, but Halle Berry as Patience Phillips was anything but brilliant. Her romance with the cop could've been more romantic and her new dual-persona was unnecessary, she could've just ''acted nice'' as Patience instead of being nice, cuz that kinda spoiled the movie. Michelle's Catwoman is a proper vigilante, as she changes from a nice girl into a fierce woman with revenge on the brain and a badly stitched cat-suit. Patience only has revenge on her brain when she's in the suit. Michelle's acting was spot-on as both Selina Kyle and Catwoman. There was an unnecessary amount of CGI used in this film: Yes the cats giving Patience her powers was needed, but the CGI used on buildings that won't be destroyed like they do in Transformers, etc, was a complete waste of time and money. The kind of time and money they could've used on writing a better screenplay and doing better research for the film's plot. In short, this film has a ton of faults, major ones at that, but Halle Berry in that cat-suit is the sole reason why you would watch this film more than once, and she's the only reason why I liked the film. Halle Berry as Catwoman is simply too hot to ignore! I want to see Halle return as Catwoman, in the same suit, but as her Batman origins dictates. This will give her better credibility as the character, plus the backstory is much more interesting than in this stand-alone flick.
